00044 #include "socklnd.h"

00046 static lnd_t                   the_ksocklnd;
00047 ksock_nal_data_t        ksocknal_data;
00048 
00049 static ksock_interface_t *
00050 ksocknal_ip2iface(lnet_ni_t *ni, __u32 ip)
00051 {
00052         ksock_net_t       *net = ni->ni_data;
00053         int                i;
00054         ksock_interface_t *iface;
00055 
00056         for (i = 0; i < net->ksnn_ninterfaces; i++) {
00057                 LASSERT(i < LNET_MAX_INTERFACES);
00058                 iface = &net->ksnn_interfaces[i];
00059 
00060                 if (iface->ksni_ipaddr == ip)
00061                         return (iface);
00062         }
00063 
00064         return (NULL);
00065 }
00066 
00067 static ksock_route_t *
00068 ksocknal_create_route (__u32 ipaddr, int port)
00069 {
00070         ksock_route_t *route;
00071 
00072         LIBCFS_ALLOC (route, sizeof (*route));
00073         if (route == NULL)
00074                 return (NULL);
00075 
00076         atomic_set (&route->ksnr_refcount, 1);
00077         route->ksnr_peer = NULL;
00078         route->ksnr_retry_interval = 0;         /* OK to connect at any time */
00079         route->ksnr_ipaddr = ipaddr;
00080         route->ksnr_port = port;
00081         route->ksnr_scheduled = 0;
00082         route->ksnr_connecting = 0;
00083         route->ksnr_connected = 0;
00084         route->ksnr_deleted = 0;
00085         route->ksnr_conn_count = 0;
00086         route->ksnr_share_count = 0;
00087 
00088         return (route);
00089 }
00090 
00091 void
00092 ksocknal_destroy_route (ksock_route_t *route)
00093 {
00094         LASSERT (atomic_read(&route->ksnr_refcount) == 0);
00095 
00096         if (route->ksnr_peer != NULL)
00097                 ksocknal_peer_decref(route->ksnr_peer);
00098 
00099         LIBCFS_FREE (route, sizeof (*route));
00100 }
00101 
00102 static int
00103 ksocknal_create_peer(ksock_peer_t **peerp, lnet_ni_t *ni, lnet_process_id_t id)
00104 {
00105         int             cpt = lnet_cpt_of_nid(id.nid);
00106         ksock_net_t     *net = ni->ni_data;
00107         ksock_peer_t    *peer;
00108 
00109         LASSERT(id.nid != LNET_NID_ANY);
00110         LASSERT(id.pid != LNET_PID_ANY);
00111         LASSERT(!in_interrupt());
00112 
00113         LIBCFS_CPT_ALLOC(peer, lnet_cpt_table(), cpt, sizeof(*peer));
00114         if (peer == NULL)
00115                 return -ENOMEM;
00116 
00117         peer->ksnp_ni = ni;
00118         peer->ksnp_id = id;
00119         atomic_set(&peer->ksnp_refcount, 1);    /* 1 ref for caller */
00120         peer->ksnp_closing = 0;
00121         peer->ksnp_accepting = 0;
00122         peer->ksnp_proto = NULL;
00123         peer->ksnp_last_alive = 0;
00124         peer->ksnp_zc_next_cookie = SOCKNAL_KEEPALIVE_PING + 1;
00125 
00126         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&peer->ksnp_conns);
00127         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&peer->ksnp_routes);
00128         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&peer->ksnp_tx_queue);
00129         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&peer->ksnp_zc_req_list);
00130         spin_lock_init(&peer->ksnp_lock);
00131 
00132         spin_lock_bh(&net->ksnn_lock);
00133 
00134         if (net->ksnn_shutdown) {
00135                 spin_unlock_bh(&net->ksnn_lock);
00136 
00137                 LIBCFS_FREE(peer, sizeof(*peer));
00138                 CERROR("Can't create peer: network shutdown\n");
00139                 return -ESHUTDOWN;
00140         }
00141 
00142         net->ksnn_npeers++;
00143 
00144         spin_unlock_bh(&net->ksnn_lock);
00145 
00146         *peerp = peer;
00147         return 0;
00148 }
00149 
00150 void
00151 ksocknal_destroy_peer (ksock_peer_t *peer)
00152 {
00153         ksock_net_t    *net = peer->ksnp_ni->ni_data;
00154 
00155         CDEBUG (D_NET, "peer %s %p deleted\n",
00156                 libcfs_id2str(peer->ksnp_id), peer);
00157 
00158         LASSERT(atomic_read(&peer->ksnp_refcount) == 0);
00159         LASSERT(peer->ksnp_accepting == 0);
00160         LASSERT(list_empty(&peer->ksnp_conns));
00161         LASSERT(list_empty(&peer->ksnp_routes));
00162         LASSERT(list_empty(&peer->ksnp_tx_queue));
00163         LASSERT(list_empty(&peer->ksnp_zc_req_list));
00164 
00165         LIBCFS_FREE(peer, sizeof(*peer));
00166 
00167         /* NB a peer's connections and routes keep a reference on their peer
00168          * until they are destroyed, so we can be assured that _all_ state to
00169          * do with this peer has been cleaned up when its refcount drops to
00170          * zero. */
00171         spin_lock_bh(&net->ksnn_lock);
00172         net->ksnn_npeers--;
00173         spin_unlock_bh(&net->ksnn_lock);
00174 }
00175 
00176 ksock_peer_t *
00177 ksocknal_find_peer_locked (lnet_ni_t *ni, lnet_process_id_t id)
00178 {
00179         struct list_head *peer_list = ksocknal_nid2peerlist(id.nid);
00180         struct list_head *tmp;
00181         ksock_peer_t     *peer;
00182 
00183         list_for_each(tmp, peer_list) {
00184 
00185                 peer = list_entry(tmp, ksock_peer_t, ksnp_list);
00186 
00187                 LASSERT(!peer->ksnp_closing);
00188 
00189                 if (peer->ksnp_ni != ni)
00190                         continue;
00191 
00192                 if (peer->ksnp_id.nid != id.nid ||
00193                     peer->ksnp_id.pid != id.pid)
00194                         continue;
00195 
00196                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "got peer [%p] -> %s (%d)\n",
00197                        peer, libcfs_id2str(id),
00198                        atomic_read(&peer->ksnp_refcount));
00199                 return peer;
00200         }
00201         return NULL;
00202 }
00203 
00204 ksock_peer_t *
00205 ksocknal_find_peer (lnet_ni_t *ni, lnet_process_id_t id)
00206 {
00207         ksock_peer_t     *peer;
00208 
00209         read_lock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
00210         peer = ksocknal_find_peer_locked(ni, id);
00211         if (peer != NULL)                       /* +1 ref for caller? */
00212                 ksocknal_peer_addref(peer);
00213         read_unlock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
00214 
00215         return (peer);
00216 }
00217 
00218 static void
00219 ksocknal_unlink_peer_locked (ksock_peer_t *peer)
00220 {
00221         int                i;
00222         __u32              ip;
00223         ksock_interface_t *iface;
00224 
00225         for (i = 0; i < peer->ksnp_n_passive_ips; i++) {
00226                 LASSERT (i < LNET_MAX_INTERFACES);
00227                 ip = peer->ksnp_passive_ips[i];
00228 
00229                 iface = ksocknal_ip2iface(peer->ksnp_ni, ip);
00230                 /* All IPs in peer->ksnp_passive_ips[] come from the
00231                  * interface list, therefore the call must succeed. */
00232                 LASSERT (iface != NULL);
00233 
00234                 CDEBUG(D_NET, "peer=%p iface=%p ksni_nroutes=%d\n",
00235                        peer, iface, iface->ksni_nroutes);
00236                 iface->ksni_npeers--;
00237         }
00238 
00239         LASSERT(list_empty(&peer->ksnp_conns));
00240         LASSERT(list_empty(&peer->ksnp_routes));
00241         LASSERT(!peer->ksnp_closing);
00242         peer->ksnp_closing = 1;
00243         list_del(&peer->ksnp_list);
00244         /* lose peerlist's ref */
00245         ksocknal_peer_decref(peer);
00246 }
00247 
00248 static int
00249 ksocknal_get_peer_info (lnet_ni_t *ni, int index,
00250                         lnet_process_id_t *id, __u32 *myip, __u32 *peer_ip,
00251                         int *port, int *conn_count, int *share_count)
00252 {
00253         ksock_peer_t      *peer;
00254         struct list_head  *ptmp;
00255         ksock_route_t     *route;
00256         struct list_head  *rtmp;
00257         int                i;
00258         int                j;
00259         int                rc = -ENOENT;
00260 
00261         read_lock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
00262 
00263         for (i = 0; i < ksocknal_data.ksnd_peer_hash_size; i++) {
00264                 list_for_each(ptmp, &ksocknal_data.ksnd_peers[i]) {
00265                         peer = list_entry(ptmp, ksock_peer_t, ksnp_list);
00266 
00267                         if (peer->ksnp_ni != ni)
00268                                 continue;
00269 
00270                         if (peer->ksnp_n_passive_ips == 0 &&
00271                             list_empty(&peer->ksnp_routes)) {
00272                                 if (index-- > 0)
00273                                         continue;
00274 
00275                                 *id = peer->ksnp_id;
00276                                 *myip = 0;
00277                                 *peer_ip = 0;
00278                                 *port = 0;
00279                                 *conn_count = 0;
00280                                 *share_count = 0;
00281                                 rc = 0;
00282                                 goto out;
00283                         }
00284 
00285                         for (j = 0; j < peer->ksnp_n_passive_ips; j++) {
00286                                 if (index-- > 0)
00287                                         continue;
00288 
00289                                 *id = peer->ksnp_id;
00290                                 *myip = peer->ksnp_passive_ips[j];
00291                                 *peer_ip = 0;
00292                                 *port = 0;
00293                                 *conn_count = 0;
00294                                 *share_count = 0;
00295                                 rc = 0;
00296                                 goto out;
00297                         }
00298 
00299                         list_for_each(rtmp, &peer->ksnp_routes) {
00300                                 if (index-- > 0)
00301                                         continue;
00302 
00303                                 route = list_entry(rtmp, ksock_route_t,
00304                                                    ksnr_list);
00305 
00306                                 *id = peer->ksnp_id;
00307                                 *myip = route->ksnr_myipaddr;
00308                                 *peer_ip = route->ksnr_ipaddr;
00309                                 *port = route->ksnr_port;
00310                                 *conn_count = route->ksnr_conn_count;
00311                                 *share_count = route->ksnr_share_count;
00312                                 rc = 0;
00313                                 goto out;
00314                         }
00315                 }
00316         }
00317 out:
00318         read_unlock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
00319         return rc;
00320 }
00321 
00322 static void
00323 ksocknal_associate_route_conn_locked(ksock_route_t *route, ksock_conn_t *conn)
00324 {
00325         ksock_peer_t      *peer = route->ksnr_peer;
00326         int                type = conn->ksnc_type;
00327         ksock_interface_t *iface;
00328 
00329         conn->ksnc_route = route;
00330         ksocknal_route_addref(route);
00331 
00332         if (route->ksnr_myipaddr != conn->ksnc_myipaddr) {
00333                 if (route->ksnr_myipaddr == 0) {
00334                         /* route wasn't bound locally yet (the initial route) */
00335                         CDEBUG(D_NET, "Binding %s %pI4h to %pI4h\n",
00336                                libcfs_id2str(peer->ksnp_id),
00337                                &route->ksnr_ipaddr,
00338                                &conn->ksnc_myipaddr);
00339                 } else {
00340                         CDEBUG(D_NET, "Rebinding %s %pI4h from %pI4h "
00341                                "to %pI4h\n", libcfs_id2str(peer->ksnp_id),
00342                                &route->ksnr_ipaddr,
00343                                &route->ksnr_myipaddr,
00344                                &conn->ksnc_myipaddr);
00345 
00346                         iface = ksocknal_ip2iface(route->ksnr_peer->ksnp_ni,
00347                                                   route->ksnr_myipaddr);
00348                         if (iface != NULL)
00349                                 iface->ksni_nroutes--;
00350                 }
00351                 route->ksnr_myipaddr = conn->ksnc_myipaddr;
00352                 iface = ksocknal_ip2iface(route->ksnr_peer->ksnp_ni,
00353                                           route->ksnr_myipaddr);
00354                 if (iface != NULL)
00355                         iface->ksni_nroutes++;
00356         }
00357 
00358         route->ksnr_connected |= (1<<type);
00359         route->ksnr_conn_count++;
00360 
00361         /* Successful connection => further attempts can
00362          * proceed immediately */
00363         route->ksnr_retry_interval = 0;
00364 }
00365 
00366 static void
00367 ksocknal_add_route_locked (ksock_peer_t *peer, ksock_route_t *route)
00368 {
00369         struct list_head *tmp;
00370         ksock_conn_t     *conn;
00371         ksock_route_t    *route2;
00372 
00373         LASSERT(!peer->ksnp_closing);
00374         LASSERT(route->ksnr_peer == NULL);
00375         LASSERT(!route->ksnr_scheduled);
00376         LASSERT(!route->ksnr_connecting);
00377         LASSERT(route->ksnr_connected == 0);
00378 
00379         /* LASSERT(unique) */
00380         list_for_each(tmp, &peer->ksnp_routes) {
00381                 route2 = list_entry(tmp, ksock_route_t, ksnr_list);
00382 
00383                 if (route2->ksnr_ipaddr == route->ksnr_ipaddr) {
00384                         CERROR("Duplicate route %s %pI4h\n",
00385                                libcfs_id2str(peer->ksnp_id),
00386                                &route->ksnr_ipaddr);
00387                         LBUG();
00388                 }
00389         }
00390 
00391         route->ksnr_peer = peer;
00392         ksocknal_peer_addref(peer);
00393         /* peer's routelist takes over my ref on 'route' */
00394         list_add_tail(&route->ksnr_list, &peer->ksnp_routes);
00395 
00396         list_for_each(tmp, &peer->ksnp_conns) {
00397                 conn = list_entry(tmp, ksock_conn_t, ksnc_list);
00398 
00399                 if (conn->ksnc_ipaddr != route->ksnr_ipaddr)
00400                         continue;
00401 
00402                 ksocknal_associate_route_conn_locked(route, conn);
00403                 /* keep going (typed routes) */
00404         }
00405 }
00406 
00407 static void
00408 ksocknal_del_route_locked (ksock_route_t *route)
00409 {
00410         ksock_peer_t      *peer = route->ksnr_peer;
00411         ksock_interface_t *iface;
00412         ksock_conn_t      *conn;
00413         struct list_head  *ctmp;
00414         struct list_head  *cnxt;
00415 
00416         LASSERT(!route->ksnr_deleted);
00417 
00418         /* Close associated conns */
00419         list_for_each_safe(ctmp, cnxt, &peer->ksnp_conns) {
00420                 conn = list_entry(ctmp, ksock_conn_t, ksnc_list);
00421 
00422                 if (conn->ksnc_route != route)
00423                         continue;
00424 
00425                 ksocknal_close_conn_locked(conn, 0);
00426         }
00427 
00428         if (route->ksnr_myipaddr != 0) {
00429                 iface = ksocknal_ip2iface(route->ksnr_peer->ksnp_ni,
00430                                           route->ksnr_myipaddr);
00431                 if (iface != NULL)
00432                         iface->ksni_nroutes--;
00433         }
00434 
00435         route->ksnr_deleted = 1;
00436         list_del(&route->ksnr_list);
00437         ksocknal_route_decref(route);           /* drop peer's ref */
00438 
00439         if (list_empty(&peer->ksnp_routes) &&
00440             list_empty(&peer->ksnp_conns)) {
00441                 /* I've just removed the last route to a peer with no active
00442                  * connections */
00443                 ksocknal_unlink_peer_locked(peer);
00444         }
00445 }
00446 
00447 int
00448 ksocknal_add_peer(lnet_ni_t *ni, lnet_process_id_t id, __u32 ipaddr, int port)
00449 {
00450         struct list_head *tmp;
00451         ksock_peer_t     *peer;
00452         ksock_peer_t     *peer2;
00453         ksock_route_t    *route;
00454         ksock_route_t    *route2;
00455         int               rc;
00456 
00457         if (id.nid == LNET_NID_ANY ||
00458             id.pid == LNET_PID_ANY)
00459                 return (-EINVAL);
00460 
00461         /* Have a brand new peer ready... */
00462         rc = ksocknal_create_peer(&peer, ni, id);
00463         if (rc != 0)
00464                 return rc;
00465 
00466         route = ksocknal_create_route (ipaddr, port);
00467         if (route == NULL) {
00468                 ksocknal_peer_decref(peer);
00469                 return (-ENOMEM);
00470         }
00471 
00472         write_lock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
00473 
00474         /* always called with a ref on ni, so shutdown can't have started */
00475         LASSERT (((ksock_net_t *) ni->ni_data)->ksnn_shutdown == 0);
00476 
00477         peer2 = ksocknal_find_peer_locked(ni, id);
00478         if (peer2 != NULL) {
00479                 ksocknal_peer_decref(peer);
00480                 peer = peer2;
00481         } else {
00482                 /* peer table takes my ref on peer */
00483                 list_add_tail(&peer->ksnp_list,
00484                               ksocknal_nid2peerlist(id.nid));
00485         }
00486 
00487         route2 = NULL;
00488         list_for_each(tmp, &peer->ksnp_routes) {
00489                 route2 = list_entry(tmp, ksock_route_t, ksnr_list);
00490 
00491                 if (route2->ksnr_ipaddr == ipaddr)
00492                         break;
00493 
00494                 route2 = NULL;
00495         }
00496         if (route2 == NULL) {
00497                 ksocknal_add_route_locked(peer, route);
00498                 route->ksnr_share_count++;
00499         } else {
00500                 ksocknal_route_decref(route);
00501                 route2->ksnr_share_count++;
00502         }
00503 
00504         write_unlock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
00505 
00506         return 0;
00507 }
00508 
00509 static void
00510 ksocknal_del_peer_locked (ksock_peer_t *peer, __u32 ip)
00511 {
00512         ksock_conn_t     *conn;
00513         ksock_route_t    *route;
00514         struct list_head *tmp;
00515         struct list_head *nxt;
00516         int               nshared;
00517 
00518         LASSERT(!peer->ksnp_closing);
00519 
00520         /* Extra ref prevents peer disappearing until I'm done with it */
00521         ksocknal_peer_addref(peer);
00522 
00523         list_for_each_safe(tmp, nxt, &peer->ksnp_routes) {
00524                 route = list_entry(tmp, ksock_route_t, ksnr_list);
00525 
00526                 /* no match */
00527                 if (!(ip == 0 || route->ksnr_ipaddr == ip))
00528                         continue;
00529 
00530                 route->ksnr_share_count = 0;
00531                 /* This deletes associated conns too */
00532                 ksocknal_del_route_locked(route);
00533         }
00534 
00535         nshared = 0;
00536         list_for_each_safe(tmp, nxt, &peer->ksnp_routes) {
00537                 route = list_entry(tmp, ksock_route_t, ksnr_list);
00538                 nshared += route->ksnr_share_count;
00539         }
00540 
00541         if (nshared == 0) {
00542                 /* remove everything else if there are no explicit entries
00543                  * left */
00544 
00545                 list_for_each_safe(tmp, nxt, &peer->ksnp_routes) {
00546                         route = list_entry(tmp, ksock_route_t, ksnr_list);
00547 
00548                         /* we should only be removing auto-entries */
00549                         LASSERT(route->ksnr_share_count == 0);
00550                         ksocknal_del_route_locked(route);
00551                 }
00552 
00553                 list_for_each_safe(tmp, nxt, &peer->ksnp_conns) {
00554                         conn = list_entry(tmp, ksock_conn_t, ksnc_list);
00555 
00556                         ksocknal_close_conn_locked(conn, 0);
00557                 }
00558         }
00559 
00560         ksocknal_peer_decref(peer);
00561                 /* NB peer unlinks itself when last conn/route is removed */
00562 }
00563 
00564 static int
00565 ksocknal_del_peer (lnet_ni_t *ni, lnet_process_id_t id, __u32 ip)
00566 {
00567         struct list_head  zombies = LIST_HEAD_INIT(zombies);
00568         struct list_head *ptmp;
00569         struct list_head *pnxt;
00570         ksock_peer_t     *peer;
00571         int               lo;
00572         int               hi;
00573         int               i;
00574         int               rc = -ENOENT;
00575 
00576         write_lock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
00577 
00578         if (id.nid != LNET_NID_ANY) {
00579                 hi = (int)(ksocknal_nid2peerlist(id.nid) -
00580                            ksocknal_data.ksnd_peers);
00581                 lo = hi;
00582         } else {
00583                 lo = 0;
00584                 hi = ksocknal_data.ksnd_peer_hash_size - 1;
00585         }
00586 
00587         for (i = lo; i <= hi; i++) {
00588                 list_for_each_safe(ptmp, pnxt,
00589                                    &ksocknal_data.ksnd_peers[i]) {
00590                         peer = list_entry(ptmp, ksock_peer_t, ksnp_list);
00591 
00592                         if (peer->ksnp_ni != ni)
00593                                 continue;
00594 
00595                         if (!((id.nid == LNET_NID_ANY ||
00596                                peer->ksnp_id.nid == id.nid) &&
00597                               (id.pid == LNET_PID_ANY ||
00598                                peer->ksnp_id.pid == id.pid)))
00599                                 continue;
00600 
00601                         ksocknal_peer_addref(peer);     /* a ref for me... */
00602 
00603                         ksocknal_del_peer_locked(peer, ip);
00604 
00605                         if (peer->ksnp_closing &&
00606                             !list_empty(&peer->ksnp_tx_queue)) {
00607                                 LASSERT(list_empty(&peer->ksnp_conns));
00608                                 LASSERT(list_empty(&peer->ksnp_routes));
00609 
00610                                 list_splice_init(&peer->ksnp_tx_queue,
00611                                                  &zombies);
00612                         }
00613 
00614                         ksocknal_peer_decref(peer);     /* ...till here */
00615 
00616                         rc = 0;                         /* matched! */
00617                 }
00618         }
00619 
00620         write_unlock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
00621 
00622         ksocknal_txlist_done(ni, &zombies, 1);
00623 
00624         return rc;
00625 }
00626 
00627 static ksock_conn_t *
00628 ksocknal_get_conn_by_idx (lnet_ni_t *ni, int index)
00629 {
00630         ksock_peer_t     *peer;
00631         struct list_head *ptmp;
00632         ksock_conn_t     *conn;
00633         struct list_head *ctmp;
00634         int               i;
00635 
00636         read_lock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
00637 
00638         for (i = 0; i < ksocknal_data.ksnd_peer_hash_size; i++) {
00639                 list_for_each(ptmp, &ksocknal_data.ksnd_peers[i]) {
00640                         peer = list_entry(ptmp, ksock_peer_t, ksnp_list);
00641 
00642                         LASSERT(!peer->ksnp_closing);
00643 
00644                         if (peer->ksnp_ni != ni)
00645                                 continue;
00646 
00647                         list_for_each(ctmp, &peer->ksnp_conns) {
00648                                 if (index-- > 0)
00649                                         continue;
00650 
00651                                 conn = list_entry(ctmp, ksock_conn_t,
00652                                                   ksnc_list);
00653                                 ksocknal_conn_addref(conn);
00654                                 read_unlock(&ksocknal_data. \
00655                                             ksnd_global_lock);
00656                                 return conn;
00657                         }
00658                 }
00659         }
00660 
00661         read_unlock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
00662         return NULL;
00663 }
00664 
00665 static ksock_sched_t *
00666 ksocknal_choose_scheduler_locked(unsigned int cpt)
00667 {
00668         struct ksock_sched_info *info = ksocknal_data.ksnd_sched_info[cpt];
00669         ksock_sched_t           *sched;
00670         int                     i;
00671 
00672         LASSERT(info->ksi_nthreads > 0);
00673 
00674         sched = &info->ksi_scheds[0];
00675         /*
00676          * NB: it's safe so far, but info->ksi_nthreads could be changed
00677          * at runtime when we have dynamic LNet configuration, then we
00678          * need to take care of this.
00679          */
00680         for (i = 1; i < info->ksi_nthreads; i++) {
00681                 if (sched->kss_nconns > info->ksi_scheds[i].kss_nconns)
00682                         sched = &info->ksi_scheds[i];
00683         }
00684 
00685         return sched;
00686 }
00687 
00688 static int
00689 ksocknal_local_ipvec (lnet_ni_t *ni, __u32 *ipaddrs)
00690 {
00691         ksock_net_t       *net = ni->ni_data;
00692         int                i;
00693         int                nip;
00694 
00695         read_lock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
00696 
00697         nip = net->ksnn_ninterfaces;
00698         LASSERT (nip <= LNET_MAX_INTERFACES);
00699 
00700         /* Only offer interfaces for additional connections if I have
00701          * more than one. */
00702         if (nip < 2) {
00703                 read_unlock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
00704                 return 0;
00705         }
00706 
00707         for (i = 0; i < nip; i++) {
00708                 ipaddrs[i] = net->ksnn_interfaces[i].ksni_ipaddr;
00709                 LASSERT (ipaddrs[i] != 0);
00710         }
00711 
00712         read_unlock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
00713         return (nip);
00714 }
00715 
00716 static int
00717 ksocknal_match_peerip (ksock_interface_t *iface, __u32 *ips, int nips)
00718 {
00719         int   best_netmatch = 0;
00720         int   best_xor      = 0;
00721         int   best          = -1;
00722         int   this_xor;
00723         int   this_netmatch;
00724         int   i;
00725 
00726         for (i = 0; i < nips; i++) {
00727                 if (ips[i] == 0)
00728                         continue;
00729 
00730                 this_xor = (ips[i] ^ iface->ksni_ipaddr);
00731                 this_netmatch = ((this_xor & iface->ksni_netmask) == 0) ? 1 : 0;
00732 
00733                 if (!(best < 0 ||
00734                       best_netmatch < this_netmatch ||
00735                       (best_netmatch == this_netmatch &&
00736                        best_xor > this_xor)))
00737                         continue;
00738 
00739                 best = i;
00740                 best_netmatch = this_netmatch;
00741                 best_xor = this_xor;
00742         }
00743 
00744         LASSERT (best >= 0);
00745         return (best);
00746 }
00747 
00748 static int
00749 ksocknal_select_ips(ksock_peer_t *peer, __u32 *peerips, int n_peerips)
00750 {
00751         rwlock_t                *global_lock = &ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock;
00752         ksock_net_t        *net = peer->ksnp_ni->ni_data;
00753         ksock_interface_t  *iface;
00754         ksock_interface_t  *best_iface;
00755         int                 n_ips;
00756         int                 i;
00757         int                 j;
00758         int                 k;
00759         __u32               ip;
00760         __u32               xor;
00761         int                 this_netmatch;
00762         int                 best_netmatch;
00763         int                 best_npeers;
00764 
00765         /* CAVEAT EMPTOR: We do all our interface matching with an
00766          * exclusive hold of global lock at IRQ priority.  We're only
00767          * expecting to be dealing with small numbers of interfaces, so the
00768          * O(n**3)-ness shouldn't matter */
00769 
00770         /* Also note that I'm not going to return more than n_peerips
00771          * interfaces, even if I have more myself */
00772 
00773         write_lock_bh(global_lock);
00774 
00775         LASSERT (n_peerips <= LNET_MAX_INTERFACES);
00776         LASSERT (net->ksnn_ninterfaces <= LNET_MAX_INTERFACES);
00777 
00778         /* Only match interfaces for additional connections
00779          * if I have > 1 interface */
00780         n_ips = (net->ksnn_ninterfaces < 2) ? 0 :
00781                 MIN(n_peerips, net->ksnn_ninterfaces);
00782 
00783         for (i = 0; peer->ksnp_n_passive_ips < n_ips; i++) {
00784                 /*              ^ yes really... */
00785 
00786                 /* If we have any new interfaces, first tick off all the
00787                  * peer IPs that match old interfaces, then choose new
00788                  * interfaces to match the remaining peer IPS.
00789                  * We don't forget interfaces we've stopped using; we might
00790                  * start using them again... */
00791 
00792                 if (i < peer->ksnp_n_passive_ips) {
00793                         /* Old interface. */
00794                         ip = peer->ksnp_passive_ips[i];
00795                         best_iface = ksocknal_ip2iface(peer->ksnp_ni, ip);
00796 
00797                         /* peer passive ips are kept up to date */
00798                         LASSERT(best_iface != NULL);
00799                 } else {
00800                         /* choose a new interface */
00801                         LASSERT (i == peer->ksnp_n_passive_ips);
00802 
00803                         best_iface = NULL;
00804                         best_netmatch = 0;
00805                         best_npeers = 0;
00806 
00807                         for (j = 0; j < net->ksnn_ninterfaces; j++) {
00808                                 iface = &net->ksnn_interfaces[j];
00809                                 ip = iface->ksni_ipaddr;
00810 
00811                                 for (k = 0; k < peer->ksnp_n_passive_ips; k++)
00812                                         if (peer->ksnp_passive_ips[k] == ip)
00813                                                 break;
00814 
00815                                 if (k < peer->ksnp_n_passive_ips) /* using it already */
00816                                         continue;
00817 
00818                                 k = ksocknal_match_peerip(iface, peerips, n_peerips);
00819                                 xor = (ip ^ peerips[k]);
00820                                 this_netmatch = ((xor & iface->ksni_netmask) == 0) ? 1 : 0;
00821 
00822                                 if (!(best_iface == NULL ||
00823                                       best_netmatch < this_netmatch ||
00824                                       (best_netmatch == this_netmatch &&
00825                                        best_npeers > iface->ksni_npeers)))
00826                                         continue;
00827 
00828                                 best_iface = iface;
00829                                 best_netmatch = this_netmatch;
00830                                 best_npeers = iface->ksni_npeers;
00831                         }
00832 
00833                         LASSERT(best_iface != NULL);
00834 
00835                         best_iface->ksni_npeers++;
00836                         ip = best_iface->ksni_ipaddr;
00837                         peer->ksnp_passive_ips[i] = ip;
00838                         peer->ksnp_n_passive_ips = i+1;
00839                 }
00840 
00841                 /* mark the best matching peer IP used */
00842                 j = ksocknal_match_peerip(best_iface, peerips, n_peerips);
00843                 peerips[j] = 0;
00844         }
00845 
00846         /* Overwrite input peer IP addresses */
00847         memcpy(peerips, peer->ksnp_passive_ips, n_ips * sizeof(*peerips));
00848 
00849         write_unlock_bh(global_lock);
00850 
00851         return (n_ips);
00852 }
00853 
00854 static void
00855 ksocknal_create_routes(ksock_peer_t *peer, int port,
00856                        __u32 *peer_ipaddrs, int npeer_ipaddrs)
00857 {
00858         ksock_route_t           *newroute = NULL;
00859         rwlock_t                *global_lock = &ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock;
00860         lnet_ni_t               *ni = peer->ksnp_ni;
00861         ksock_net_t             *net = ni->ni_data;
00862         struct list_head        *rtmp;
00863         ksock_route_t           *route;
00864         ksock_interface_t       *iface;
00865         ksock_interface_t       *best_iface;
00866         int                     best_netmatch;
00867         int                     this_netmatch;
00868         int                     best_nroutes;
00869         int                     i;
00870         int                     j;
00871 
00872         /* CAVEAT EMPTOR: We do all our interface matching with an
00873          * exclusive hold of global lock at IRQ priority.  We're only
00874          * expecting to be dealing with small numbers of interfaces, so the
00875          * O(n**3)-ness here shouldn't matter */
00876 
00877         write_lock_bh(global_lock);
00878 
00879         if (net->ksnn_ninterfaces < 2) {
00880                 /* Only create additional connections
00881                  * if I have > 1 interface */
00882                 write_unlock_bh(global_lock);
00883                 return;
00884         }
00885 
00886         LASSERT (npeer_ipaddrs <= LNET_MAX_INTERFACES);
00887 
00888         for (i = 0; i < npeer_ipaddrs; i++) {
00889                 if (newroute != NULL) {
00890                         newroute->ksnr_ipaddr = peer_ipaddrs[i];
00891                 } else {
00892                         write_unlock_bh(global_lock);
00893 
00894                         newroute = ksocknal_create_route(peer_ipaddrs[i], port);
00895                         if (newroute == NULL)
00896                                 return;
00897 
00898                         write_lock_bh(global_lock);
00899                 }
00900 
00901                 if (peer->ksnp_closing) {
00902                         /* peer got closed under me */
00903                         break;
00904                 }
00905 
00906                 /* Already got a route? */
00907                 route = NULL;
00908                 list_for_each(rtmp, &peer->ksnp_routes) {
00909                         route = list_entry(rtmp, ksock_route_t, ksnr_list);
00910 
00911                         if (route->ksnr_ipaddr == newroute->ksnr_ipaddr)
00912                                 break;
00913 
00914                         route = NULL;
00915                 }
00916                 if (route != NULL)
00917                         continue;
00918 
00919                 best_iface = NULL;
00920                 best_nroutes = 0;
00921                 best_netmatch = 0;
00922 
00923                 LASSERT(net->ksnn_ninterfaces <= LNET_MAX_INTERFACES);
00924 
00925                 /* Select interface to connect from */
00926                 for (j = 0; j < net->ksnn_ninterfaces; j++) {
00927                         iface = &net->ksnn_interfaces[j];
00928 
00929                         /* Using this interface already? */
00930                         list_for_each(rtmp, &peer->ksnp_routes) {
00931                                 route = list_entry(rtmp, ksock_route_t,
00932                                                    ksnr_list);
00933 
00934                                 if (route->ksnr_myipaddr == iface->ksni_ipaddr)
00935                                         break;
00936 
00937                                 route = NULL;
00938                         }
00939                         if (route != NULL)
00940                                 continue;
00941 
00942                         this_netmatch = (((iface->ksni_ipaddr ^
00943                                            newroute->ksnr_ipaddr) &
00944                                            iface->ksni_netmask) == 0) ? 1 : 0;
00945 
00946                         if (!(best_iface == NULL ||
00947                               best_netmatch < this_netmatch ||
00948                               (best_netmatch == this_netmatch &&
00949                                best_nroutes > iface->ksni_nroutes)))
00950                                 continue;
00951 
00952                         best_iface = iface;
00953                         best_netmatch = this_netmatch;
00954                         best_nroutes = iface->ksni_nroutes;
00955                 }
00956 
00957                 if (best_iface == NULL)
00958                         continue;
00959 
00960                 newroute->ksnr_myipaddr = best_iface->ksni_ipaddr;
00961                 best_iface->ksni_nroutes++;
00962 
00963                 ksocknal_add_route_locked(peer, newroute);
00964                 newroute = NULL;
00965         }
00966 
00967         write_unlock_bh(global_lock);
00968         if (newroute != NULL)
00969                 ksocknal_route_decref(newroute);
00970 }
00971 
00972 int
00973 ksocknal_accept(lnet_ni_t *ni, struct socket *sock)
00974 {
00975         ksock_connreq_t *cr;
00976         int              rc;
00977         __u32            peer_ip;
00978         int              peer_port;
00979 
00980         rc = lnet_sock_getaddr(sock, true, &peer_ip, &peer_port);
00981         LASSERT(rc == 0);               /* we succeeded before */
00982 
00983         LIBCFS_ALLOC(cr, sizeof(*cr));
00984         if (cr == NULL) {
00985                 LCONSOLE_ERROR_MSG(0x12f, "Dropping connection request from "
00986                                    "%pI4h: memory exhausted\n", &peer_ip);
00987                 return -ENOMEM;
00988         }
00989 
00990         lnet_ni_addref(ni);
00991         cr->ksncr_ni   = ni;
00992         cr->ksncr_sock = sock;
00993 
00994         spin_lock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_lock);
00995 
00996         list_add_tail(&cr->ksncr_list, &ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_connreqs);
00997         wake_up(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_waitq);
00998 
00999         spin_unlock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_lock);
01000         return 0;
01001 }
01002 
01003 static int
01004 ksocknal_connecting (ksock_peer_t *peer, __u32 ipaddr)
01005 {
01006         ksock_route_t *route;
01007 
01008         list_for_each_entry(route, &peer->ksnp_routes, ksnr_list) {
01009                 if (route->ksnr_ipaddr == ipaddr)
01010                         return route->ksnr_connecting;
01011         }
01012         return 0;
01013 }
01014 
01015 int
01016 ksocknal_create_conn(lnet_ni_t *ni, ksock_route_t *route,
01017                      struct socket *sock, int type)
01018 {
01019         rwlock_t                *global_lock = &ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock;
01020         struct list_head        zombies = LIST_HEAD_INIT(zombies);
01021         lnet_process_id_t       peerid;
01022         struct list_head        *tmp;
01023         __u64              incarnation;
01024         ksock_conn_t      *conn;
01025         ksock_conn_t      *conn2;
01026         ksock_peer_t      *peer = NULL;
01027         ksock_peer_t      *peer2;
01028         ksock_sched_t     *sched;
01029         ksock_hello_msg_t *hello;
01030         int                cpt;
01031         ksock_tx_t        *tx;
01032         ksock_tx_t        *txtmp;
01033         int                rc;
01034         int                active;
01035         char              *warn = NULL;
01036 
01037         active = (route != NULL);
01038 
01039         LASSERT (active == (type != SOCKLND_CONN_NONE));
01040 
01041         LIBCFS_ALLOC(conn, sizeof(*conn));
01042         if (conn == NULL) {
01043                 rc = -ENOMEM;
01044                 goto failed_0;
01045         }
01046 
01047         conn->ksnc_peer = NULL;
01048         conn->ksnc_route = NULL;
01049         conn->ksnc_sock = sock;
01050         /* 2 ref, 1 for conn, another extra ref prevents socket
01051          * being closed before establishment of connection */
01052         atomic_set (&conn->ksnc_sock_refcount, 2);
01053         conn->ksnc_type = type;
01054         ksocknal_lib_save_callback(sock, conn);
01055         atomic_set (&conn->ksnc_conn_refcount, 1); /* 1 ref for me */
01056 
01057         conn->ksnc_rx_ready = 0;
01058         conn->ksnc_rx_scheduled = 0;
01059 
01060         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&conn->ksnc_tx_queue);
01061         conn->ksnc_tx_ready = 0;
01062         conn->ksnc_tx_scheduled = 0;
01063         conn->ksnc_tx_carrier = NULL;
01064         atomic_set (&conn->ksnc_tx_nob, 0);
01065 
01066         LIBCFS_ALLOC(hello, offsetof(ksock_hello_msg_t,
01067                                      kshm_ips[LNET_MAX_INTERFACES]));
01068         if (hello == NULL) {
01069                 rc = -ENOMEM;
01070                 goto failed_1;
01071         }
01072 
01073         /* stash conn's local and remote addrs */
01074         rc = ksocknal_lib_get_conn_addrs (conn);
01075         if (rc != 0)
01076                 goto failed_1;
01077 
01078         /* Find out/confirm peer's NID and connection type and get the
01079          * vector of interfaces she's willing to let me connect to.
01080          * Passive connections use the listener timeout since the peer sends
01081          * eagerly */
01082 
01083         if (active) {
01084                 peer = route->ksnr_peer;
01085                 LASSERT(ni == peer->ksnp_ni);
01086 
01087                 /* Active connection sends HELLO eagerly */
01088                 hello->kshm_nips = ksocknal_local_ipvec(ni, hello->kshm_ips);
01089                 peerid = peer->ksnp_id;
01090 
01091                 write_lock_bh(global_lock);
01092                 conn->ksnc_proto = peer->ksnp_proto;
01093                 write_unlock_bh(global_lock);
01094 
01095                 if (conn->ksnc_proto == NULL) {
01096                          conn->ksnc_proto = &ksocknal_protocol_v3x;
01097 #if SOCKNAL_VERSION_DEBUG
01098                          if (*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_protocol == 2)
01099                                  conn->ksnc_proto = &ksocknal_protocol_v2x;
01100                          else if (*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_protocol == 1)
01101                                  conn->ksnc_proto = &ksocknal_protocol_v1x;
01102 #endif
01103                 }
01104 
01105                 rc = ksocknal_send_hello (ni, conn, peerid.nid, hello);
01106                 if (rc != 0)
01107                         goto failed_1;
01108         } else {
01109                 peerid.nid = LNET_NID_ANY;
01110                 peerid.pid = LNET_PID_ANY;
01111 
01112                 /* Passive, get protocol from peer */
01113                 conn->ksnc_proto = NULL;
01114         }
01115 
01116         rc = ksocknal_recv_hello (ni, conn, hello, &peerid, &incarnation);
01117         if (rc < 0)
01118                 goto failed_1;
01119 
01120         LASSERT (rc == 0 || active);
01121         LASSERT (conn->ksnc_proto != NULL);
01122         LASSERT (peerid.nid != LNET_NID_ANY);
01123 
01124         cpt = lnet_cpt_of_nid(peerid.nid);
01125 
01126         if (active) {
01127                 ksocknal_peer_addref(peer);
01128                 write_lock_bh(global_lock);
01129         } else {
01130                 rc = ksocknal_create_peer(&peer, ni, peerid);
01131                 if (rc != 0)
01132                         goto failed_1;
01133 
01134                 write_lock_bh(global_lock);
01135 
01136                 /* called with a ref on ni, so shutdown can't have started */
01137                 LASSERT (((ksock_net_t *) ni->ni_data)->ksnn_shutdown == 0);
01138 
01139                 peer2 = ksocknal_find_peer_locked(ni, peerid);
01140                 if (peer2 == NULL) {
01141                         /* NB this puts an "empty" peer in the peer
01142                          * table (which takes my ref) */
01143                         list_add_tail(&peer->ksnp_list,
01144                                       ksocknal_nid2peerlist(peerid.nid));
01145                 } else {
01146                         ksocknal_peer_decref(peer);
01147                         peer = peer2;
01148                 }
01149 
01150                 /* +1 ref for me */
01151                 ksocknal_peer_addref(peer);
01152                 peer->ksnp_accepting++;
01153 
01154                 /* Am I already connecting to this guy?  Resolve in
01155                  * favour of higher NID... */
01156                 if (peerid.nid < ni->ni_nid &&
01157                     ksocknal_connecting(peer, conn->ksnc_ipaddr)) {
01158                         rc = EALREADY;
01159                         warn = "connection race resolution";
01160                         goto failed_2;
01161                 }
01162         }
01163 
01164         if (peer->ksnp_closing ||
01165             (active && route->ksnr_deleted)) {
01166                 /* peer/route got closed under me */
01167                 rc = -ESTALE;
01168                 warn = "peer/route removed";
01169                 goto failed_2;
01170         }
01171 
01172         if (peer->ksnp_proto == NULL) {
01173                 /* Never connected before.
01174                  * NB recv_hello may have returned EPROTO to signal my peer
01175                  * wants a different protocol than the one I asked for.
01176                  */
01177                 LASSERT(list_empty(&peer->ksnp_conns));
01178 
01179                 peer->ksnp_proto = conn->ksnc_proto;
01180                 peer->ksnp_incarnation = incarnation;
01181         }
01182 
01183         if (peer->ksnp_proto != conn->ksnc_proto ||
01184             peer->ksnp_incarnation != incarnation) {
01185                 /* Peer rebooted or I've got the wrong protocol version */
01186                 ksocknal_close_peer_conns_locked(peer, 0, 0);
01187 
01188                 peer->ksnp_proto = NULL;
01189                 rc = ESTALE;
01190                 warn = peer->ksnp_incarnation != incarnation ?
01191                        "peer rebooted" :
01192                        "wrong proto version";
01193                 goto failed_2;
01194         }
01195 
01196         switch (rc) {
01197         default:
01198                 LBUG();
01199         case 0:
01200                 break;
01201         case EALREADY:
01202                 warn = "lost conn race";
01203                 goto failed_2;
01204         case EPROTO:
01205                 warn = "retry with different protocol version";
01206                 goto failed_2;
01207         }
01208 
01209         /* Refuse to duplicate an existing connection, unless this is a
01210          * loopback connection */
01211         if (conn->ksnc_ipaddr != conn->ksnc_myipaddr) {
01212                 list_for_each(tmp, &peer->ksnp_conns) {
01213                         conn2 = list_entry(tmp, ksock_conn_t, ksnc_list);
01214 
01215                         if (conn2->ksnc_ipaddr != conn->ksnc_ipaddr ||
01216                             conn2->ksnc_myipaddr != conn->ksnc_myipaddr ||
01217                             conn2->ksnc_type != conn->ksnc_type)
01218                                 continue;
01219 
01220                         /* Reply on a passive connection attempt so the peer
01221                          * realises we're connected. */
01222                         LASSERT (rc == 0);
01223                         if (!active)
01224                                 rc = EALREADY;
01225 
01226                         warn = "duplicate";
01227                         goto failed_2;
01228                 }
01229         }
01230 
01231         /* If the connection created by this route didn't bind to the IP
01232          * address the route connected to, the connection/route matching
01233          * code below probably isn't going to work. */
01234         if (active &&
01235             route->ksnr_ipaddr != conn->ksnc_ipaddr) {
01236                 CERROR("Route %s %pI4h connected to %pI4h\n",
01237                        libcfs_id2str(peer->ksnp_id),
01238                        &route->ksnr_ipaddr,
01239                        &conn->ksnc_ipaddr);
01240         }
01241 
01242         /* Search for a route corresponding to the new connection and
01243          * create an association.  This allows incoming connections created
01244          * by routes in my peer to match my own route entries so I don't
01245          * continually create duplicate routes. */
01246         list_for_each(tmp, &peer->ksnp_routes) {
01247                 route = list_entry(tmp, ksock_route_t, ksnr_list);
01248 
01249                 if (route->ksnr_ipaddr != conn->ksnc_ipaddr)
01250                         continue;
01251 
01252                 ksocknal_associate_route_conn_locked(route, conn);
01253                 break;
01254         }
01255 
01256         conn->ksnc_peer = peer;                 /* conn takes my ref on peer */
01257         peer->ksnp_last_alive = cfs_time_current();
01258         peer->ksnp_send_keepalive = 0;
01259         peer->ksnp_error = 0;
01260 
01261         sched = ksocknal_choose_scheduler_locked(cpt);
01262         sched->kss_nconns++;
01263         conn->ksnc_scheduler = sched;
01264 
01265         conn->ksnc_tx_last_post = cfs_time_current();
01266         /* Set the deadline for the outgoing HELLO to drain */
01267         conn->ksnc_tx_bufnob = sock->sk->sk_wmem_queued;
01268         conn->ksnc_tx_deadline = cfs_time_shift(*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_timeout);
01269         smp_mb();   /* order with adding to peer's conn list */
01270 
01271         list_add(&conn->ksnc_list, &peer->ksnp_conns);
01272         ksocknal_conn_addref(conn);
01273 
01274         ksocknal_new_packet(conn, 0);
01275 
01276         conn->ksnc_zc_capable = ksocknal_lib_zc_capable(conn);
01277 
01278         /* Take packets blocking for this connection. */
01279         list_for_each_entry_safe(tx, txtmp, &peer->ksnp_tx_queue, tx_list) {
01280                 if (conn->ksnc_proto->pro_match_tx(conn, tx, tx->tx_nonblk) ==
01281                     SOCKNAL_MATCH_NO)
01282                         continue;
01283 
01284                 list_del(&tx->tx_list);
01285                 ksocknal_queue_tx_locked(tx, conn);
01286         }
01287 
01288         write_unlock_bh(global_lock);
01289 
01290         /* We've now got a new connection.  Any errors from here on are just
01291          * like "normal" comms errors and we close the connection normally.
01292          * NB (a) we still have to send the reply HELLO for passive
01293          *        connections,
01294          *    (b) normal I/O on the conn is blocked until I setup and call the
01295          *        socket callbacks.
01296          */
01297 
01298         CDEBUG(D_NET, "New conn %s p %d.x %pI4h -> %pI4h/%d"
01299                " incarnation:%lld sched[%d:%d]\n",
01300                libcfs_id2str(peerid), conn->ksnc_proto->pro_version,
01301                &conn->ksnc_myipaddr, &conn->ksnc_ipaddr,
01302                conn->ksnc_port, incarnation, cpt,
01303                (int)(sched - &sched->kss_info->ksi_scheds[0]));
01304 
01305         if (active) {
01306                 /* additional routes after interface exchange? */
01307                 ksocknal_create_routes(peer, conn->ksnc_port,
01308                                        hello->kshm_ips, hello->kshm_nips);
01309         } else {
01310                 hello->kshm_nips = ksocknal_select_ips(peer, hello->kshm_ips,
01311                                                        hello->kshm_nips);
01312                 rc = ksocknal_send_hello(ni, conn, peerid.nid, hello);
01313         }
01314 
01315         LIBCFS_FREE(hello, offsetof(ksock_hello_msg_t,
01316                                     kshm_ips[LNET_MAX_INTERFACES]));
01317 
01318         /* setup the socket AFTER I've received hello (it disables
01319          * SO_LINGER).  I might call back to the acceptor who may want
01320          * to send a protocol version response and then close the
01321          * socket; this ensures the socket only tears down after the
01322          * response has been sent. */
01323         if (rc == 0)
01324                 rc = ksocknal_lib_setup_sock(sock);
01325 
01326         write_lock_bh(global_lock);
01327 
01328         /* NB my callbacks block while I hold ksnd_global_lock */
01329         ksocknal_lib_set_callback(sock, conn);
01330 
01331         if (!active)
01332                 peer->ksnp_accepting--;
01333 
01334         write_unlock_bh(global_lock);
01335 
01336         if (rc != 0) {
01337                 write_lock_bh(global_lock);
01338                 if (!conn->ksnc_closing) {
01339                         /* could be closed by another thread */
01340                         ksocknal_close_conn_locked(conn, rc);
01341                 }
01342                 write_unlock_bh(global_lock);
01343         } else if (ksocknal_connsock_addref(conn) == 0) {
01344                 /* Allow I/O to proceed. */
01345                 ksocknal_read_callback(conn);
01346                 ksocknal_write_callback(conn);
01347                 ksocknal_connsock_decref(conn);
01348         }
01349 
01350         ksocknal_connsock_decref(conn);
01351         ksocknal_conn_decref(conn);
01352         return rc;
01353 
01354 failed_2:
01355         if (!peer->ksnp_closing &&
01356             list_empty(&peer->ksnp_conns) &&
01357             list_empty(&peer->ksnp_routes)) {
01358                 list_add(&zombies, &peer->ksnp_tx_queue);
01359                 list_del_init(&peer->ksnp_tx_queue);
01360                 ksocknal_unlink_peer_locked(peer);
01361         }
01362 
01363         write_unlock_bh(global_lock);
01364 
01365         if (warn != NULL) {
01366                 if (rc < 0)
01367                         CERROR("Not creating conn %s type %d: %s\n",
01368                                libcfs_id2str(peerid), conn->ksnc_type, warn);
01369                 else
01370                         CDEBUG(D_NET, "Not creating conn %s type %d: %s\n",
01371                               libcfs_id2str(peerid), conn->ksnc_type, warn);
01372         }
01373 
01374         if (!active) {
01375                 if (rc > 0) {
01376                         /* Request retry by replying with CONN_NONE
01377                          * ksnc_proto has been set already */
01378                         conn->ksnc_type = SOCKLND_CONN_NONE;
01379                         hello->kshm_nips = 0;
01380                         ksocknal_send_hello(ni, conn, peerid.nid, hello);
01381                 }
01382 
01383                 write_lock_bh(global_lock);
01384                 peer->ksnp_accepting--;
01385                 write_unlock_bh(global_lock);
01386         }
01387 
01388         ksocknal_txlist_done(ni, &zombies, 1);
01389         ksocknal_peer_decref(peer);
01390 
01391  failed_1:
01392         if (hello != NULL)
01393                 LIBCFS_FREE(hello, offsetof(ksock_hello_msg_t,
01394                                             kshm_ips[LNET_MAX_INTERFACES]));
01395 
01396         LIBCFS_FREE(conn, sizeof(*conn));
01397 
01398 failed_0:
01399         sock_release(sock);
01400         return rc;
01401 }
01402 
01403 void
01404 ksocknal_close_conn_locked (ksock_conn_t *conn, int error)
01405 {
01406         /* This just does the immmediate housekeeping, and queues the
01407          * connection for the reaper to terminate.
01408          * Caller holds ksnd_global_lock exclusively in irq context */
01409         ksock_peer_t      *peer = conn->ksnc_peer;
01410         ksock_route_t     *route;
01411         ksock_conn_t      *conn2;
01412         struct list_head  *tmp;
01413 
01414         LASSERT(peer->ksnp_error == 0);
01415         LASSERT(!conn->ksnc_closing);
01416         conn->ksnc_closing = 1;
01417 
01418         /* ksnd_deathrow_conns takes over peer's ref */
01419         list_del(&conn->ksnc_list);
01420 
01421         route = conn->ksnc_route;
01422         if (route != NULL) {
01423                 /* dissociate conn from route... */
01424                 LASSERT(!route->ksnr_deleted);
01425                 LASSERT((route->ksnr_connected & (1 << conn->ksnc_type)) != 0);
01426 
01427                 conn2 = NULL;
01428                 list_for_each(tmp, &peer->ksnp_conns) {
01429                         conn2 = list_entry(tmp, ksock_conn_t, ksnc_list);
01430 
01431                         if (conn2->ksnc_route == route &&
01432                             conn2->ksnc_type == conn->ksnc_type)
01433                                 break;
01434 
01435                         conn2 = NULL;
01436                 }
01437                 if (conn2 == NULL)
01438                         route->ksnr_connected &= ~(1 << conn->ksnc_type);
01439 
01440                 conn->ksnc_route = NULL;
01441 
01442 #if 0           /* irrelevent with only eager routes */
01443                 /* make route least favourite */
01444                 list_del(&route->ksnr_list);
01445                 list_add_tail(&route->ksnr_list, &peer->ksnp_routes);
01446 #endif
01447                 ksocknal_route_decref(route);   /* drop conn's ref on route */
01448         }
01449 
01450         if (list_empty(&peer->ksnp_conns)) {
01451                 /* No more connections to this peer */
01452 
01453                 if (!list_empty(&peer->ksnp_tx_queue)) {
01454                                 ksock_tx_t *tx;
01455 
01456                         LASSERT(conn->ksnc_proto == &ksocknal_protocol_v3x);
01457 
01458                         /* throw them to the last connection...,
01459                          * these TXs will be send to /dev/null by scheduler */
01460                         list_for_each_entry(tx, &peer->ksnp_tx_queue,
01461                                             tx_list)
01462                                 ksocknal_tx_prep(conn, tx);
01463 
01464                         spin_lock_bh(&conn->ksnc_scheduler->kss_lock);
01465                         list_splice_init(&peer->ksnp_tx_queue,
01466                                          &conn->ksnc_tx_queue);
01467                         spin_unlock_bh(&conn->ksnc_scheduler->kss_lock);
01468                 }
01469 
01470                 /* renegotiate protocol version */
01471                 peer->ksnp_proto = NULL;
01472                 /* stash last conn close reason */
01473                 peer->ksnp_error = error;
01474 
01475                 if (list_empty(&peer->ksnp_routes)) {
01476                         /* I've just closed last conn belonging to a
01477                          * peer with no routes to it */
01478                         ksocknal_unlink_peer_locked(peer);
01479                 }
01480         }
01481 
01482         spin_lock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_reaper_lock);
01483 
01484         list_add_tail(&conn->ksnc_list,
01485                       &ksocknal_data.ksnd_deathrow_conns);
01486         wake_up(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_reaper_waitq);
01487 
01488         spin_unlock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_reaper_lock);
01489 }
01490 
01491 void
01492 ksocknal_peer_failed (ksock_peer_t *peer)
01493 {
01494         int        notify = 0;
01495         cfs_time_t last_alive = 0;
01496 
01497         /* There has been a connection failure or comms error; but I'll only
01498          * tell LNET I think the peer is dead if it's to another kernel and
01499          * there are no connections or connection attempts in existence. */
01500 
01501         read_lock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
01502 
01503         if ((peer->ksnp_id.pid & LNET_PID_USERFLAG) == 0 &&
01504              list_empty(&peer->ksnp_conns) &&
01505              peer->ksnp_accepting == 0 &&
01506              ksocknal_find_connecting_route_locked(peer) == NULL) {
01507                 notify = 1;
01508                 last_alive = peer->ksnp_last_alive;
01509         }
01510 
01511         read_unlock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
01512 
01513         if (notify)
01514                 lnet_notify(peer->ksnp_ni, peer->ksnp_id.nid, 0,
01515                             last_alive);
01516 }
01517 
01518 void
01519 ksocknal_finalize_zcreq(ksock_conn_t *conn)
01520 {
01521         ksock_peer_t     *peer = conn->ksnc_peer;
01522         ksock_tx_t       *tx;
01523         ksock_tx_t       *tmp;
01524         struct list_head  zlist = LIST_HEAD_INIT(zlist);
01525 
01526         /* NB safe to finalize TXs because closing of socket will
01527          * abort all buffered data */
01528         LASSERT(conn->ksnc_sock == NULL);
01529 
01530         spin_lock(&peer->ksnp_lock);
01531 
01532         list_for_each_entry_safe(tx, tmp, &peer->ksnp_zc_req_list, tx_zc_list) {
01533                 if (tx->tx_conn != conn)
01534                         continue;
01535 
01536                 LASSERT(tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0] != 0);
01537 
01538                 tx->tx_msg.ksm_zc_cookies[0] = 0;
01539                 tx->tx_zc_aborted = 1;  /* mark it as not-acked */
01540                 list_del(&tx->tx_zc_list);
01541                 list_add(&tx->tx_zc_list, &zlist);
01542         }
01543 
01544         spin_unlock(&peer->ksnp_lock);
01545 
01546         while (!list_empty(&zlist)) {
01547                 tx = list_entry(zlist.next, ksock_tx_t, tx_zc_list);
01548 
01549                 list_del(&tx->tx_zc_list);
01550                 ksocknal_tx_decref(tx);
01551         }
01552 }
01553 
01554 void
01555 ksocknal_terminate_conn(ksock_conn_t *conn)
01556 {
01557         /* This gets called by the reaper (guaranteed thread context) to
01558          * disengage the socket from its callbacks and close it.
01559          * ksnc_refcount will eventually hit zero, and then the reaper will
01560          * destroy it. */
01561         ksock_peer_t     *peer = conn->ksnc_peer;
01562         ksock_sched_t    *sched = conn->ksnc_scheduler;
01563         int               failed = 0;
01564 
01565         LASSERT(conn->ksnc_closing);
01566 
01567         /* wake up the scheduler to "send" all remaining packets to /dev/null */
01568         spin_lock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
01569 
01570         /* a closing conn is always ready to tx */
01571         conn->ksnc_tx_ready = 1;
01572 
01573         if (!conn->ksnc_tx_scheduled &&
01574             !list_empty(&conn->ksnc_tx_queue)) {
01575                 list_add_tail(&conn->ksnc_tx_list,
01576                                &sched->kss_tx_conns);
01577                 conn->ksnc_tx_scheduled = 1;
01578                 /* extra ref for scheduler */
01579                 ksocknal_conn_addref(conn);
01580 
01581                 wake_up (&sched->kss_waitq);
01582         }
01583 
01584         spin_unlock_bh(&sched->kss_lock);
01585 
01586         /* serialise with callbacks */
01587         write_lock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
01588 
01589         ksocknal_lib_reset_callback(conn->ksnc_sock, conn);
01590 
01591         /* OK, so this conn may not be completely disengaged from its
01592          * scheduler yet, but it _has_ committed to terminate... */
01593         conn->ksnc_scheduler->kss_nconns--;
01594 
01595         if (peer->ksnp_error != 0) {
01596                 /* peer's last conn closed in error */
01597                 LASSERT(list_empty(&peer->ksnp_conns));
01598                 failed = 1;
01599                 peer->ksnp_error = 0;     /* avoid multiple notifications */
01600         }
01601 
01602         write_unlock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
01603 
01604         if (failed)
01605                 ksocknal_peer_failed(peer);
01606 
01607         /* The socket is closed on the final put; either here, or in
01608          * ksocknal_{send,recv}msg().  Since we set up the linger2 option
01609          * when the connection was established, this will close the socket
01610          * immediately, aborting anything buffered in it. Any hung
01611          * zero-copy transmits will therefore complete in finite time. */
01612         ksocknal_connsock_decref(conn);
01613 }
01614 
01615 void
01616 ksocknal_queue_zombie_conn (ksock_conn_t *conn)
01617 {
01618         /* Queue the conn for the reaper to destroy */
01619 
01620         LASSERT(atomic_read(&conn->ksnc_conn_refcount) == 0);
01621         spin_lock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_reaper_lock);
01622 
01623         list_add_tail(&conn->ksnc_list, &ksocknal_data.ksnd_zombie_conns);
01624         wake_up(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_reaper_waitq);
01625 
01626         spin_unlock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_reaper_lock);
01627 }
01628 
01629 void
01630 ksocknal_destroy_conn (ksock_conn_t *conn)
01631 {
01632         cfs_time_t      last_rcv;
01633 
01634         /* Final coup-de-grace of the reaper */
01635         CDEBUG (D_NET, "connection %p\n", conn);
01636 
01637         LASSERT (atomic_read (&conn->ksnc_conn_refcount) == 0);
01638         LASSERT (atomic_read (&conn->ksnc_sock_refcount) == 0);
01639         LASSERT (conn->ksnc_sock == NULL);
01640         LASSERT (conn->ksnc_route == NULL);
01641         LASSERT (!conn->ksnc_tx_scheduled);
01642         LASSERT (!conn->ksnc_rx_scheduled);
01643         LASSERT(list_empty(&conn->ksnc_tx_queue));
01644 
01645         /* complete current receive if any */
01646         switch (conn->ksnc_rx_state) {
01647         case SOCKNAL_RX_LNET_PAYLOAD:
01648                 last_rcv = conn->ksnc_rx_deadline -
01649                            cfs_time_seconds(*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_timeout);
01650                 CERROR("Completing partial receive from %s[%d], "
01651                        "ip %pI4h:%d, with error, wanted: %d, left: %d, "
01652                        "last alive is %ld secs ago\n",
01653                        libcfs_id2str(conn->ksnc_peer->ksnp_id), conn->ksnc_type,
01654                        &conn->ksnc_ipaddr, conn->ksnc_port,
01655                        conn->ksnc_rx_nob_wanted, conn->ksnc_rx_nob_left,
01656                        cfs_duration_sec(cfs_time_sub(cfs_time_current(),
01657                                         last_rcv)));
01658                 lnet_finalize (conn->ksnc_peer->ksnp_ni,
01659                                conn->ksnc_cookie, -EIO);
01660                 break;
01661         case SOCKNAL_RX_LNET_HEADER:
01662                 if (conn->ksnc_rx_started)
01663                         CERROR("Incomplete receive of lnet header from %s, "
01664                                "ip %pI4h:%d, with error, protocol: %d.x.\n",
01665                                libcfs_id2str(conn->ksnc_peer->ksnp_id),
01666                                &conn->ksnc_ipaddr, conn->ksnc_port,
01667                                conn->ksnc_proto->pro_version);
01668                 break;
01669         case SOCKNAL_RX_KSM_HEADER:
01670                 if (conn->ksnc_rx_started)
01671                         CERROR("Incomplete receive of ksock message from %s, "
01672                                "ip %pI4h:%d, with error, protocol: %d.x.\n",
01673                                libcfs_id2str(conn->ksnc_peer->ksnp_id),
01674                                &conn->ksnc_ipaddr, conn->ksnc_port,
01675                                conn->ksnc_proto->pro_version);
01676                 break;
01677         case SOCKNAL_RX_SLOP:
01678                 if (conn->ksnc_rx_started)
01679                         CERROR("Incomplete receive of slops from %s, "
01680                                "ip %pI4h:%d, with error\n",
01681                                libcfs_id2str(conn->ksnc_peer->ksnp_id),
01682                                &conn->ksnc_ipaddr, conn->ksnc_port);
01683                break;
01684         default:
01685                 LBUG ();
01686                 break;
01687         }
01688 
01689         ksocknal_peer_decref(conn->ksnc_peer);
01690 
01691         LIBCFS_FREE (conn, sizeof (*conn));
01692 }
01693 
01694 int
01695 ksocknal_close_peer_conns_locked (ksock_peer_t *peer, __u32 ipaddr, int why)
01696 {
01697         ksock_conn_t       *conn;
01698         struct list_head         *ctmp;
01699         struct list_head         *cnxt;
01700         int                 count = 0;
01701 
01702         list_for_each_safe(ctmp, cnxt, &peer->ksnp_conns) {
01703                 conn = list_entry(ctmp, ksock_conn_t, ksnc_list);
01704 
01705                 if (ipaddr == 0 ||
01706                     conn->ksnc_ipaddr == ipaddr) {
01707                         count++;
01708                         ksocknal_close_conn_locked (conn, why);
01709                 }
01710         }
01711 
01712         return (count);
01713 }
01714 
01715 int
01716 ksocknal_close_conn_and_siblings (ksock_conn_t *conn, int why)
01717 {
01718         ksock_peer_t     *peer = conn->ksnc_peer;
01719         __u32             ipaddr = conn->ksnc_ipaddr;
01720         int               count;
01721 
01722         write_lock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
01723 
01724         count = ksocknal_close_peer_conns_locked (peer, ipaddr, why);
01725 
01726         write_unlock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
01727 
01728         return (count);
01729 }
01730 
01731 int
01732 ksocknal_close_matching_conns (lnet_process_id_t id, __u32 ipaddr)
01733 {
01734         ksock_peer_t       *peer;
01735         struct list_head         *ptmp;
01736         struct list_head         *pnxt;
01737         int                 lo;
01738         int                 hi;
01739         int                 i;
01740         int                 count = 0;
01741 
01742         write_lock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
01743 
01744         if (id.nid != LNET_NID_ANY)
01745                 lo = hi = (int)(ksocknal_nid2peerlist(id.nid) - ksocknal_data.ksnd_peers);
01746         else {
01747                 lo = 0;
01748                 hi = ksocknal_data.ksnd_peer_hash_size - 1;
01749         }
01750 
01751         for (i = lo; i <= hi; i++) {
01752                 list_for_each_safe(ptmp, pnxt, &ksocknal_data.ksnd_peers[i]) {
01753 
01754                         peer = list_entry(ptmp, ksock_peer_t, ksnp_list);
01755 
01756                         if (!((id.nid == LNET_NID_ANY || id.nid == peer->ksnp_id.nid) &&
01757                               (id.pid == LNET_PID_ANY || id.pid == peer->ksnp_id.pid)))
01758                                 continue;
01759 
01760                         count += ksocknal_close_peer_conns_locked (peer, ipaddr, 0);
01761                 }
01762         }
01763 
01764         write_unlock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
01765 
01766         /* wildcards always succeed */
01767         if (id.nid == LNET_NID_ANY || id.pid == LNET_PID_ANY || ipaddr == 0)
01768                 return (0);
01769 
01770         return (count == 0 ? -ENOENT : 0);
01771 }
01772 
01773 void
01774 ksocknal_notify (lnet_ni_t *ni, lnet_nid_t gw_nid, int alive)
01775 {
01776         /* The router is telling me she's been notified of a change in
01777          * gateway state.... */
01778         lnet_process_id_t  id = {0};
01779 
01780         id.nid = gw_nid;
01781         id.pid = LNET_PID_ANY;
01782 
01783         CDEBUG (D_NET, "gw %s %s\n", libcfs_nid2str(gw_nid),
01784                 alive ? "up" : "down");
01785 
01786         if (!alive) {
01787                 /* If the gateway crashed, close all open connections... */
01788                 ksocknal_close_matching_conns (id, 0);
01789                 return;
01790         }
01791 
01792         /* ...otherwise do nothing.  We can only establish new connections
01793          * if we have autroutes, and these connect on demand. */
01794 }
01795 
01796 void
01797 ksocknal_query (lnet_ni_t *ni, lnet_nid_t nid, cfs_time_t *when)
01798 {
01799         int                connect = 1;
01800         cfs_time_t         last_alive = 0;
01801         cfs_time_t         now = cfs_time_current();
01802         ksock_peer_t      *peer = NULL;
01803         rwlock_t                *glock = &ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock;
01804         lnet_process_id_t  id = {
01805                 .nid = nid,
01806                 .pid = LNET_PID_LUSTRE,
01807         };
01808 
01809         read_lock(glock);
01810 
01811         peer = ksocknal_find_peer_locked(ni, id);
01812         if (peer != NULL) {
01813                 struct list_head       *tmp;
01814                 ksock_conn_t     *conn;
01815                 int               bufnob;
01816 
01817                 list_for_each(tmp, &peer->ksnp_conns) {
01818                         conn = list_entry(tmp, ksock_conn_t, ksnc_list);
01819                         bufnob = conn->ksnc_sock->sk->sk_wmem_queued;
01820 
01821                         if (bufnob < conn->ksnc_tx_bufnob) {
01822                                 /* something got ACKed */
01823                                 conn->ksnc_tx_deadline =
01824                                         cfs_time_shift(*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_timeout);
01825                                 peer->ksnp_last_alive = now;
01826                                 conn->ksnc_tx_bufnob = bufnob;
01827                         }
01828                 }
01829 
01830                 last_alive = peer->ksnp_last_alive;
01831                 if (ksocknal_find_connectable_route_locked(peer) == NULL)
01832                         connect = 0;
01833         }
01834 
01835         read_unlock(glock);
01836 
01837         if (last_alive != 0)
01838                 *when = last_alive;
01839 
01840         CDEBUG(D_NET, "Peer %s %p, alive %ld secs ago, connect %d\n",
01841                libcfs_nid2str(nid), peer,
01842                last_alive ? cfs_duration_sec(now - last_alive) : -1,
01843                connect);
01844 
01845         if (!connect)
01846                 return;
01847 
01848         ksocknal_add_peer(ni, id, LNET_NIDADDR(nid), lnet_acceptor_port());
01849 
01850         write_lock_bh(glock);
01851 
01852         peer = ksocknal_find_peer_locked(ni, id);
01853         if (peer != NULL)
01854                 ksocknal_launch_all_connections_locked(peer);
01855 
01856         write_unlock_bh(glock);
01857         return;
01858 }
01859 
01860 static void
01861 ksocknal_push_peer (ksock_peer_t *peer)
01862 {
01863         int               index;
01864         int               i;
01865         struct list_head       *tmp;
01866         ksock_conn_t     *conn;
01867 
01868         for (index = 0; ; index++) {
01869                 read_lock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
01870 
01871                 i = 0;
01872                 conn = NULL;
01873 
01874                 list_for_each(tmp, &peer->ksnp_conns) {
01875                         if (i++ == index) {
01876                                 conn = list_entry(tmp, ksock_conn_t,
01877                                                        ksnc_list);
01878                                 ksocknal_conn_addref(conn);
01879                                 break;
01880                         }
01881                 }
01882 
01883                 read_unlock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
01884 
01885                 if (conn == NULL)
01886                         break;
01887 
01888                 ksocknal_lib_push_conn (conn);
01889                 ksocknal_conn_decref(conn);
01890         }
01891 }
01892 
01893 static int
01894 ksocknal_push (lnet_ni_t *ni, lnet_process_id_t id)
01895 {
01896         struct list_head *start;
01897         struct list_head *end;
01898         struct list_head *tmp;
01899         int               rc = -ENOENT;
01900         unsigned int      hsize = ksocknal_data.ksnd_peer_hash_size;
01901 
01902         if (id.nid == LNET_NID_ANY) {
01903                 start = &ksocknal_data.ksnd_peers[0];
01904                 end = &ksocknal_data.ksnd_peers[hsize - 1];
01905         } else {
01906                 start = end = ksocknal_nid2peerlist(id.nid);
01907         }
01908 
01909         for (tmp = start; tmp <= end; tmp++) {
01910                 int     peer_off; /* searching offset in peer hash table */
01911 
01912                 for (peer_off = 0; ; peer_off++) {
01913                         ksock_peer_t *peer;
01914                         int           i = 0;
01915 
01916                         read_lock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
01917                         list_for_each_entry(peer, tmp, ksnp_list) {
01918                                 if (!((id.nid == LNET_NID_ANY ||
01919                                        id.nid == peer->ksnp_id.nid) &&
01920                                       (id.pid == LNET_PID_ANY ||
01921                                        id.pid == peer->ksnp_id.pid)))
01922                                         continue;
01923 
01924                                 if (i++ == peer_off) {
01925                                         ksocknal_peer_addref(peer);
01926                                         break;
01927                                 }
01928                         }
01929                         read_unlock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
01930 
01931                         if (i == 0) /* no match */
01932                                 break;
01933 
01934                         rc = 0;
01935                         ksocknal_push_peer(peer);
01936                         ksocknal_peer_decref(peer);
01937                 }
01938         }
01939         return rc;
01940 }
01941 
01942 static int
01943 ksocknal_add_interface(lnet_ni_t *ni, __u32 ipaddress, __u32 netmask)
01944 {
01945         ksock_net_t       *net = ni->ni_data;
01946         ksock_interface_t *iface;
01947         int                rc;
01948         int                i;
01949         int                j;
01950         struct list_head        *ptmp;
01951         ksock_peer_t      *peer;
01952         struct list_head        *rtmp;
01953         ksock_route_t     *route;
01954 
01955         if (ipaddress == 0 ||
01956             netmask == 0)
01957                 return (-EINVAL);
01958 
01959         write_lock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
01960 
01961         iface = ksocknal_ip2iface(ni, ipaddress);
01962         if (iface != NULL) {
01963                 /* silently ignore dups */
01964                 rc = 0;
01965         } else if (net->ksnn_ninterfaces == LNET_MAX_INTERFACES) {
01966                 rc = -ENOSPC;
01967         } else {
01968                 iface = &net->ksnn_interfaces[net->ksnn_ninterfaces++];
01969 
01970                 iface->ksni_ipaddr = ipaddress;
01971                 iface->ksni_netmask = netmask;
01972                 iface->ksni_nroutes = 0;
01973                 iface->ksni_npeers = 0;
01974 
01975                 for (i = 0; i < ksocknal_data.ksnd_peer_hash_size; i++) {
01976                         list_for_each(ptmp, &ksocknal_data.ksnd_peers[i]) {
01977                                 peer = list_entry(ptmp, ksock_peer_t,
01978                                                       ksnp_list);
01979 
01980                                 for (j = 0; j < peer->ksnp_n_passive_ips; j++)
01981                                         if (peer->ksnp_passive_ips[j] == ipaddress)
01982                                                 iface->ksni_npeers++;
01983 
01984                                 list_for_each(rtmp, &peer->ksnp_routes) {
01985                                         route = list_entry(rtmp,
01986                                                                ksock_route_t,
01987                                                                ksnr_list);
01988 
01989                                         if (route->ksnr_myipaddr == ipaddress)
01990                                                 iface->ksni_nroutes++;
01991                                 }
