01992                         }
01993                 }
01994 
01995                 rc = 0;
01996                 /* NB only new connections will pay attention to the new interface! */
01997         }
01998 
01999         write_unlock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
02000 
02001         return (rc);
02002 }
02003 
02004 static void
02005 ksocknal_peer_del_interface_locked(ksock_peer_t *peer, __u32 ipaddr)
02006 {
02007         struct list_head         *tmp;
02008         struct list_head         *nxt;
02009         ksock_route_t      *route;
02010         ksock_conn_t       *conn;
02011         int                 i;
02012         int                 j;
02013 
02014         for (i = 0; i < peer->ksnp_n_passive_ips; i++)
02015                 if (peer->ksnp_passive_ips[i] == ipaddr) {
02016                         for (j = i+1; j < peer->ksnp_n_passive_ips; j++)
02017                                 peer->ksnp_passive_ips[j-1] =
02018                                         peer->ksnp_passive_ips[j];
02019                         peer->ksnp_n_passive_ips--;
02020                         break;
02021                 }
02022 
02023         list_for_each_safe(tmp, nxt, &peer->ksnp_routes) {
02024                 route = list_entry(tmp, ksock_route_t, ksnr_list);
02025 
02026                 if (route->ksnr_myipaddr != ipaddr)
02027                         continue;
02028 
02029                 if (route->ksnr_share_count != 0) {
02030                         /* Manually created; keep, but unbind */
02031                         route->ksnr_myipaddr = 0;
02032                 } else {
02033                         ksocknal_del_route_locked(route);
02034                 }
02035         }
02036 
02037         list_for_each_safe(tmp, nxt, &peer->ksnp_conns) {
02038                 conn = list_entry(tmp, ksock_conn_t, ksnc_list);
02039 
02040                 if (conn->ksnc_myipaddr == ipaddr)
02041                         ksocknal_close_conn_locked (conn, 0);
02042         }
02043 }
02044 
02045 static int
02046 ksocknal_del_interface(lnet_ni_t *ni, __u32 ipaddress)
02047 {
02048         ksock_net_t       *net = ni->ni_data;
02049         int                rc = -ENOENT;
02050         struct list_head        *tmp;
02051         struct list_head        *nxt;
02052         ksock_peer_t      *peer;
02053         __u32              this_ip;
02054         int                i;
02055         int                j;
02056 
02057         write_lock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
02058 
02059         for (i = 0; i < net->ksnn_ninterfaces; i++) {
02060                 this_ip = net->ksnn_interfaces[i].ksni_ipaddr;
02061 
02062                 if (!(ipaddress == 0 ||
02063                       ipaddress == this_ip))
02064                         continue;
02065 
02066                 rc = 0;
02067 
02068                 for (j = i+1; j < net->ksnn_ninterfaces; j++)
02069                         net->ksnn_interfaces[j-1] =
02070                                 net->ksnn_interfaces[j];
02071 
02072                 net->ksnn_ninterfaces--;
02073 
02074                 for (j = 0; j < ksocknal_data.ksnd_peer_hash_size; j++) {
02075                         list_for_each_safe(tmp, nxt,
02076                                                &ksocknal_data.ksnd_peers[j]) {
02077                                 peer = list_entry(tmp, ksock_peer_t,
02078                                                       ksnp_list);
02079 
02080                                 if (peer->ksnp_ni != ni)
02081                                         continue;
02082 
02083                                 ksocknal_peer_del_interface_locked(peer, this_ip);
02084                         }
02085                 }
02086         }
02087 
02088         write_unlock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
02089 
02090         return (rc);
02091 }
02092 
02093 int
02094 ksocknal_ctl(lnet_ni_t *ni, unsigned int cmd, void *arg)
02095 {
02096         lnet_process_id_t id = {0};
02097         struct libcfs_ioctl_data *data = arg;
02098         int rc;
02099 
02100         switch(cmd) {
02101         case IOC_LIBCFS_GET_INTERFACE: {
02102                 ksock_net_t       *net = ni->ni_data;
02103                 ksock_interface_t *iface;
02104 
02105                 read_lock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
02106 
02107                 if (data->ioc_count >= (__u32)net->ksnn_ninterfaces) {
02108                         rc = -ENOENT;
02109                 } else {
02110                         rc = 0;
02111                         iface = &net->ksnn_interfaces[data->ioc_count];
02112 
02113                         data->ioc_u32[0] = iface->ksni_ipaddr;
02114                         data->ioc_u32[1] = iface->ksni_netmask;
02115                         data->ioc_u32[2] = iface->ksni_npeers;
02116                         data->ioc_u32[3] = iface->ksni_nroutes;
02117                 }
02118 
02119                 read_unlock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
02120                 return rc;
02121         }
02122 
02123         case IOC_LIBCFS_ADD_INTERFACE:
02124                 return ksocknal_add_interface(ni,
02125                                               data->ioc_u32[0], /* IP address */
02126                                               data->ioc_u32[1]); /* net mask */
02127 
02128         case IOC_LIBCFS_DEL_INTERFACE:
02129                 return ksocknal_del_interface(ni,
02130                                               data->ioc_u32[0]); /* IP address */
02131 
02132         case IOC_LIBCFS_GET_PEER: {
02133                 __u32            myip = 0;
02134                 __u32            ip = 0;
02135                 int              port = 0;
02136                 int              conn_count = 0;
02137                 int              share_count = 0;
02138 
02139                 rc = ksocknal_get_peer_info(ni, data->ioc_count,
02140                                             &id, &myip, &ip, &port,
02141                                             &conn_count,  &share_count);
02142                 if (rc != 0)
02143                         return rc;
02144 
02145                 data->ioc_nid    = id.nid;
02146                 data->ioc_count  = share_count;
02147                 data->ioc_u32[0] = ip;
02148                 data->ioc_u32[1] = port;
02149                 data->ioc_u32[2] = myip;
02150                 data->ioc_u32[3] = conn_count;
02151                 data->ioc_u32[4] = id.pid;
02152                 return 0;
02153         }
02154 
02155         case IOC_LIBCFS_ADD_PEER:
02156                 id.nid = data->ioc_nid;
02157                 id.pid = LNET_PID_LUSTRE;
02158                 return ksocknal_add_peer (ni, id,
02159                                           data->ioc_u32[0], /* IP */
02160                                           data->ioc_u32[1]); /* port */
02161 
02162         case IOC_LIBCFS_DEL_PEER:
02163                 id.nid = data->ioc_nid;
02164                 id.pid = LNET_PID_ANY;
02165                 return ksocknal_del_peer (ni, id,
02166                                           data->ioc_u32[0]); /* IP */
02167 
02168         case IOC_LIBCFS_GET_CONN: {
02169                 int           txmem;
02170                 int           rxmem;
02171                 int           nagle;
02172                 ksock_conn_t *conn = ksocknal_get_conn_by_idx (ni, data->ioc_count);
02173 
02174                 if (conn == NULL)
02175                         return -ENOENT;
02176 
02177                 ksocknal_lib_get_conn_tunables(conn, &txmem, &rxmem, &nagle);
02178 
02179                 data->ioc_count  = txmem;
02180                 data->ioc_nid    = conn->ksnc_peer->ksnp_id.nid;
02181                 data->ioc_flags  = nagle;
02182                 data->ioc_u32[0] = conn->ksnc_ipaddr;
02183                 data->ioc_u32[1] = conn->ksnc_port;
02184                 data->ioc_u32[2] = conn->ksnc_myipaddr;
02185                 data->ioc_u32[3] = conn->ksnc_type;
02186                 data->ioc_u32[4] = conn->ksnc_scheduler->kss_info->ksi_cpt;
02187                 data->ioc_u32[5] = rxmem;
02188                 data->ioc_u32[6] = conn->ksnc_peer->ksnp_id.pid;
02189                 ksocknal_conn_decref(conn);
02190                 return 0;
02191         }
02192 
02193         case IOC_LIBCFS_CLOSE_CONNECTION:
02194                 id.nid = data->ioc_nid;
02195                 id.pid = LNET_PID_ANY;
02196                 return ksocknal_close_matching_conns (id,
02197                                                       data->ioc_u32[0]);
02198 
02199         case IOC_LIBCFS_REGISTER_MYNID:
02200                 /* Ignore if this is a noop */
02201                 if (data->ioc_nid == ni->ni_nid)
02202                         return 0;
02203 
02204                 CERROR("obsolete IOC_LIBCFS_REGISTER_MYNID: %s(%s)\n",
02205                        libcfs_nid2str(data->ioc_nid),
02206                        libcfs_nid2str(ni->ni_nid));
02207                 return -EINVAL;
02208 
02209         case IOC_LIBCFS_PUSH_CONNECTION:
02210                 id.nid = data->ioc_nid;
02211                 id.pid = LNET_PID_ANY;
02212                 return ksocknal_push(ni, id);
02213 
02214         default:
02215                 return -EINVAL;
02216         }
02217         /* not reached */
02218 }
02219 
02220 static void
02221 ksocknal_free_buffers (void)
02222 {
02223         LASSERT (atomic_read(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_nactive_txs) == 0);
02224 
02225         if (ksocknal_data.ksnd_sched_info != NULL) {
02226                 struct ksock_sched_info *info;
02227                 int                     i;
02228 
02229                 cfs_percpt_for_each(info, i, ksocknal_data.ksnd_sched_info) {
02230                         if (info->ksi_scheds != NULL) {
02231                                 LIBCFS_FREE(info->ksi_scheds,
02232                                             info->ksi_nthreads_max *
02233                                             sizeof(info->ksi_scheds[0]));
02234                         }
02235                 }
02236                 cfs_percpt_free(ksocknal_data.ksnd_sched_info);
02237         }
02238 
02239         LIBCFS_FREE (ksocknal_data.ksnd_peers,
02240                      sizeof(struct list_head) *
02241                      ksocknal_data.ksnd_peer_hash_size);
02242 
02243         spin_lock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_tx_lock);
02244 
02245         if (!list_empty(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_idle_noop_txs)) {
02246                 struct list_head        zlist;
02247                 ksock_tx_t      *tx;
02248 
02249                 list_add(&zlist, &ksocknal_data.ksnd_idle_noop_txs);
02250                 list_del_init(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_idle_noop_txs);
02251                 spin_unlock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_tx_lock);
02252 
02253                 while (!list_empty(&zlist)) {
02254                         tx = list_entry(zlist.next, ksock_tx_t, tx_list);
02255                         list_del(&tx->tx_list);
02256                         LIBCFS_FREE(tx, tx->tx_desc_size);
02257                 }
02258         } else {
02259                 spin_unlock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_tx_lock);
02260         }
02261 }
02262 
02263 static void
02264 ksocknal_base_shutdown(void)
02265 {
02266         struct ksock_sched_info *info;
02267         ksock_sched_t           *sched;
02268         int                     i;
02269         int                     j;
02270 
02271         CDEBUG(D_MALLOC, "before NAL cleanup: kmem %d\n",
02272                atomic_read (&libcfs_kmemory));
02273         LASSERT (ksocknal_data.ksnd_nnets == 0);
02274 
02275         switch (ksocknal_data.ksnd_init) {
02276         default:
02277                 LASSERT (0);
02278 
02279         case SOCKNAL_INIT_ALL:
02280         case SOCKNAL_INIT_DATA:
02281                 LASSERT (ksocknal_data.ksnd_peers != NULL);
02282                 for (i = 0; i < ksocknal_data.ksnd_peer_hash_size; i++) {
02283                         LASSERT(list_empty(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_peers[i]));
02284                 }
02285 
02286                 LASSERT(list_empty(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_nets));
02287                 LASSERT(list_empty(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_enomem_conns));
02288                 LASSERT(list_empty(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_zombie_conns));
02289                 LASSERT(list_empty(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_connreqs));
02290                 LASSERT(list_empty(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_routes));
02291 
02292                 if (ksocknal_data.ksnd_sched_info != NULL) {
02293                         cfs_percpt_for_each(info, i,
02294                                             ksocknal_data.ksnd_sched_info) {
02295                                 if (info->ksi_scheds == NULL)
02296                                         continue;
02297 
02298                                 for (j = 0; j < info->ksi_nthreads_max; j++) {
02299 
02300                                         sched = &info->ksi_scheds[j];
02301                                         LASSERT(list_empty(&sched->\
02302                                                                kss_tx_conns));
02303                                         LASSERT(list_empty(&sched->\
02304                                                                kss_rx_conns));
02305                                         LASSERT(list_empty(&sched-> \
02306                                                   kss_zombie_noop_txs));
02307                                         LASSERT(sched->kss_nconns == 0);
02308                                 }
02309                         }
02310                 }
02311 
02312                 /* flag threads to terminate; wake and wait for them to die */
02313                 ksocknal_data.ksnd_shuttingdown = 1;
02314                 wake_up_all(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_waitq);
02315                 wake_up_all(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_reaper_waitq);
02316 
02317                 if (ksocknal_data.ksnd_sched_info != NULL) {
02318                         cfs_percpt_for_each(info, i,
02319                                             ksocknal_data.ksnd_sched_info) {
02320                                 if (info->ksi_scheds == NULL)
02321                                         continue;
02322 
02323                                 for (j = 0; j < info->ksi_nthreads_max; j++) {
02324                                         sched = &info->ksi_scheds[j];
02325                                         wake_up_all(&sched->kss_waitq);
02326                                 }
02327                         }
02328                 }
02329 
02330                 i = 4;
02331                 read_lock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
02332                 while (ksocknal_data.ksnd_nthreads != 0) {
02333                         i++;
02334                         /* power of 2? */
02335                         CDEBUG(((i & (-i)) == i) ? D_WARNING : D_NET,
02336                                 "waiting for %d threads to terminate\n",
02337                                 ksocknal_data.ksnd_nthreads);
02338                         read_unlock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
02339                         set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
02340                         schedule_timeout(cfs_time_seconds(1));
02341                         read_lock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
02342                 }
02343                 read_unlock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
02344 
02345                 ksocknal_free_buffers();
02346 
02347                 ksocknal_data.ksnd_init = SOCKNAL_INIT_NOTHING;
02348                 break;
02349         }
02350 
02351         CDEBUG(D_MALLOC, "after NAL cleanup: kmem %d\n",
02352                atomic_read (&libcfs_kmemory));
02353 
02354         module_put(THIS_MODULE);
02355 }
02356 
02357 static __u64 ksocknal_new_incarnation(void)
02358 {
02359         struct timeval tv;
02360 
02361         /* The incarnation number is the time this module loaded and it
02362          * identifies this particular instance of the socknal.  Hopefully
02363          * we won't be able to reboot more frequently than 1MHz for the
02364          * forseeable future :) */
02365 
02366         do_gettimeofday(&tv);
02367 
02368         return (((__u64)tv.tv_sec) * 1000000) + tv.tv_usec;
02369 }
02370 
02371 static int
02372 ksocknal_base_startup(void)
02373 {
02374         struct ksock_sched_info *info;
02375         int                     rc;
02376         int                     i;
02377 
02378         LASSERT (ksocknal_data.ksnd_init == SOCKNAL_INIT_NOTHING);
02379         LASSERT (ksocknal_data.ksnd_nnets == 0);
02380 
02381         memset (&ksocknal_data, 0, sizeof (ksocknal_data)); /* zero pointers */
02382 
02383         ksocknal_data.ksnd_peer_hash_size = SOCKNAL_PEER_HASH_SIZE;
02384         LIBCFS_ALLOC(ksocknal_data.ksnd_peers,
02385                      sizeof(struct list_head) *
02386                      ksocknal_data.ksnd_peer_hash_size);
02387         if (ksocknal_data.ksnd_peers == NULL)
02388                 return -ENOMEM;
02389 
02390         for (i = 0; i < ksocknal_data.ksnd_peer_hash_size; i++)
02391                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_peers[i]);
02392 
02393         rwlock_init(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
02394         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_nets);
02395 
02396         spin_lock_init(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_reaper_lock);
02397         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_enomem_conns);
02398         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_zombie_conns);
02399         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_deathrow_conns);
02400         init_waitqueue_head(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_reaper_waitq);
02401 
02402         spin_lock_init(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_lock);
02403         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_connreqs);
02404         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_routes);
02405         init_waitqueue_head(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_waitq);
02406 
02407         spin_lock_init(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_tx_lock);
02408         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_idle_noop_txs);
02409 
02410         /* NB memset above zeros whole of ksocknal_data */
02411 
02412         /* flag lists/ptrs/locks initialised */
02413         ksocknal_data.ksnd_init = SOCKNAL_INIT_DATA;
02414         try_module_get(THIS_MODULE);
02415 
02416         ksocknal_data.ksnd_sched_info = cfs_percpt_alloc(lnet_cpt_table(),
02417                                                          sizeof(*info));
02418         if (ksocknal_data.ksnd_sched_info == NULL)
02419                 goto failed;
02420 
02421         cfs_percpt_for_each(info, i, ksocknal_data.ksnd_sched_info) {
02422                 ksock_sched_t   *sched;
02423                 int             nthrs;
02424 
02425                 nthrs = cfs_cpt_weight(lnet_cpt_table(), i);
02426                 if (*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_nscheds > 0) {
02427                         nthrs = min(nthrs, *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_nscheds);
02428                 } else {
02429                         /* max to half of CPUs, assume another half should be
02430                          * reserved for upper layer modules */
02431                         nthrs = min(max(SOCKNAL_NSCHEDS, nthrs >> 1), nthrs);
02432                 }
02433 
02434                 info->ksi_nthreads_max = nthrs;
02435                 info->ksi_cpt = i;
02436 
02437                 LIBCFS_CPT_ALLOC(info->ksi_scheds, lnet_cpt_table(), i,
02438                                  info->ksi_nthreads_max * sizeof(*sched));
02439                 if (info->ksi_scheds == NULL)
02440                         goto failed;
02441 
02442                 for (; nthrs > 0; nthrs--) {
02443                         sched = &info->ksi_scheds[nthrs - 1];
02444 
02445                         sched->kss_info = info;
02446                         spin_lock_init(&sched->kss_lock);
02447                         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&sched->kss_rx_conns);
02448                         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&sched->kss_tx_conns);
02449                         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&sched->kss_zombie_noop_txs);
02450                         init_waitqueue_head(&sched->kss_waitq);
02451                 }
02452         }
02453 
02454         ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_starting         = 0;
02455         ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_failed_stamp     = 0;
02456         ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_starting_stamp   = cfs_time_current_sec();
02457         /* must have at least 2 connds to remain responsive to accepts while
02458          * connecting */
02459         if (*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_nconnds < SOCKNAL_CONND_RESV + 1)
02460                 *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_nconnds = SOCKNAL_CONND_RESV + 1;
02461 
02462         if (*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_nconnds_max <
02463             *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_nconnds) {
02464                 ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_nconnds_max =
02465                         ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_nconnds;
02466         }
02467 
02468         for (i = 0; i < *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_nconnds; i++) {
02469                 char name[16];
02470                 spin_lock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_lock);
02471                 ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_starting++;
02472                 spin_unlock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_lock);
02473 
02474 
02475                 snprintf(name, sizeof(name), "socknal_cd%02d", i);
02476                 rc = ksocknal_thread_start(ksocknal_connd,
02477                                            (void *)((ulong_ptr_t)i), name);
02478                 if (rc != 0) {
02479                         spin_lock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_lock);
02480                         ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_starting--;
02481                         spin_unlock_bh(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_connd_lock);
02482                         CERROR("Can't spawn socknal connd: %d\n", rc);
02483                         goto failed;
02484                 }
02485         }
02486 
02487         rc = ksocknal_thread_start(ksocknal_reaper, NULL, "socknal_reaper");
02488         if (rc != 0) {
02489                 CERROR ("Can't spawn socknal reaper: %d\n", rc);
02490                 goto failed;
02491         }
02492 
02493         /* flag everything initialised */
02494         ksocknal_data.ksnd_init = SOCKNAL_INIT_ALL;
02495 
02496         return 0;
02497 
02498  failed:
02499         ksocknal_base_shutdown();
02500         return -ENETDOWN;
02501 }
02502 
02503 static void
02504 ksocknal_debug_peerhash (lnet_ni_t *ni)
02505 {
02506         ksock_peer_t    *peer = NULL;
02507         struct list_head        *tmp;
02508         int             i;
02509 
02510         read_lock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
02511 
02512         for (i = 0; i < ksocknal_data.ksnd_peer_hash_size; i++) {
02513                 list_for_each(tmp, &ksocknal_data.ksnd_peers[i]) {
02514                         peer = list_entry(tmp, ksock_peer_t, ksnp_list);
02515 
02516                         if (peer->ksnp_ni == ni) break;
02517 
02518                         peer = NULL;
02519                 }
02520         }
02521 
02522         if (peer != NULL) {
02523                 ksock_route_t *route;
02524                 ksock_conn_t  *conn;
02525 
02526                 CWARN ("Active peer on shutdown: %s, ref %d, scnt %d, "
02527                        "closing %d, accepting %d, err %d, zcookie "LPU64", "
02528                        "txq %d, zc_req %d\n", libcfs_id2str(peer->ksnp_id),
02529                        atomic_read(&peer->ksnp_refcount),
02530                        peer->ksnp_sharecount, peer->ksnp_closing,
02531                        peer->ksnp_accepting, peer->ksnp_error,
02532                        peer->ksnp_zc_next_cookie,
02533                        !list_empty(&peer->ksnp_tx_queue),
02534                        !list_empty(&peer->ksnp_zc_req_list));
02535 
02536                 list_for_each(tmp, &peer->ksnp_routes) {
02537                         route = list_entry(tmp, ksock_route_t, ksnr_list);
02538                         CWARN ("Route: ref %d, schd %d, conn %d, cnted %d, "
02539                                "del %d\n", atomic_read(&route->ksnr_refcount),
02540                                route->ksnr_scheduled, route->ksnr_connecting,
02541                                route->ksnr_connected, route->ksnr_deleted);
02542                 }
02543 
02544                 list_for_each(tmp, &peer->ksnp_conns) {
02545                         conn = list_entry(tmp, ksock_conn_t, ksnc_list);
02546                         CWARN ("Conn: ref %d, sref %d, t %d, c %d\n",
02547                                atomic_read(&conn->ksnc_conn_refcount),
02548                                atomic_read(&conn->ksnc_sock_refcount),
02549                                conn->ksnc_type, conn->ksnc_closing);
02550                 }
02551         }
02552 
02553         read_unlock(&ksocknal_data.ksnd_global_lock);
02554         return;
02555 }
02556 
02557 void
02558 ksocknal_shutdown (lnet_ni_t *ni)
02559 {
02560         ksock_net_t      *net = ni->ni_data;
02561         int               i;
02562         lnet_process_id_t anyid = {0};
02563 
02564         anyid.nid =  LNET_NID_ANY;
02565         anyid.pid =  LNET_PID_ANY;
02566 
02567         LASSERT(ksocknal_data.ksnd_init == SOCKNAL_INIT_ALL);
02568         LASSERT(ksocknal_data.ksnd_nnets > 0);
02569 
02570         spin_lock_bh(&net->ksnn_lock);
02571         net->ksnn_shutdown = 1;                 /* prevent new peers */
02572         spin_unlock_bh(&net->ksnn_lock);
02573 
02574         /* Delete all peers */
02575         ksocknal_del_peer(ni, anyid, 0);
02576 
02577         /* Wait for all peer state to clean up */
02578         i = 2;
02579         spin_lock_bh(&net->ksnn_lock);
02580         while (net->ksnn_npeers != 0) {
02581                 spin_unlock_bh(&net->ksnn_lock);
02582 
02583                 i++;
02584                 CDEBUG(((i & (-i)) == i) ? D_WARNING : D_NET, /* power of 2? */
02585                        "waiting for %d peers to disconnect\n",
02586                        net->ksnn_npeers);
02587                 set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
02588                 schedule_timeout(cfs_time_seconds(1));
02589 
02590                 ksocknal_debug_peerhash(ni);
02591 
02592                 spin_lock_bh(&net->ksnn_lock);
02593         }
02594         spin_unlock_bh(&net->ksnn_lock);
02595 
02596         for (i = 0; i < net->ksnn_ninterfaces; i++) {
02597                 LASSERT (net->ksnn_interfaces[i].ksni_npeers == 0);
02598                 LASSERT (net->ksnn_interfaces[i].ksni_nroutes == 0);
02599         }
02600 
02601         list_del(&net->ksnn_list);
02602         LIBCFS_FREE(net, sizeof(*net));
02603 
02604         ksocknal_data.ksnd_nnets--;
02605         if (ksocknal_data.ksnd_nnets == 0)
02606                 ksocknal_base_shutdown();
02607 }
02608 
02609 static int
02610 ksocknal_enumerate_interfaces(ksock_net_t *net)
02611 {
02612         char      **names;
02613         int         i;
02614         int         j;
02615         int         rc;
02616         int         n;
02617 
02618         n = lnet_ipif_enumerate(&names);
02619         if (n <= 0) {
02620                 CERROR("Can't enumerate interfaces: %d\n", n);
02621                 return n;
02622         }
02623 
02624         for (i = j = 0; i < n; i++) {
02625                 int        up;
02626                 __u32      ip;
02627                 __u32      mask;
02628 
02629                 if (!strcmp(names[i], "lo")) /* skip the loopback IF */
02630                         continue;
02631 
02632                 rc = lnet_ipif_query(names[i], &up, &ip, &mask);
02633                 if (rc != 0) {
02634                         CWARN("Can't get interface %s info: %d\n",
02635                               names[i], rc);
02636                         continue;
02637                 }
02638 
02639                 if (!up) {
02640                         CWARN("Ignoring interface %s (down)\n",
02641                               names[i]);
02642                         continue;
02643                 }
02644 
02645                 if (j == LNET_MAX_INTERFACES) {
02646                         CWARN("Ignoring interface %s (too many interfaces)\n",
02647                               names[i]);
02648                         continue;
02649                 }
02650 
02651                 net->ksnn_interfaces[j].ksni_ipaddr = ip;
02652                 net->ksnn_interfaces[j].ksni_netmask = mask;
02653                 strlcpy(net->ksnn_interfaces[j].ksni_name,
02654                         names[i], sizeof(net->ksnn_interfaces[j].ksni_name));
02655                 j++;
02656         }
02657 
02658         lnet_ipif_free_enumeration(names, n);
02659 
02660         if (j == 0)
02661                 CERROR("Can't find any usable interfaces\n");
02662 
02663         return j;
02664 }
02665 
02666 static int
02667 ksocknal_search_new_ipif(ksock_net_t *net)
02668 {
02669         int     new_ipif = 0;
02670         int     i;
02671 
02672         for (i = 0; i < net->ksnn_ninterfaces; i++) {
02673                 char            *ifnam = &net->ksnn_interfaces[i].ksni_name[0];
02674                 char            *colon = strchr(ifnam, ':');
02675                 int             found  = 0;
02676                 ksock_net_t     *tmp;
02677                 int             j;
02678 
02679                 if (colon != NULL) /* ignore alias device */
02680                         *colon = 0;
02681 
02682                 list_for_each_entry(tmp, &ksocknal_data.ksnd_nets,
02683                                         ksnn_list) {
02684                         for (j = 0; !found && j < tmp->ksnn_ninterfaces; j++) {
02685                                 char *ifnam2 = &tmp->ksnn_interfaces[j].\
02686                                              ksni_name[0];
02687                                 char *colon2 = strchr(ifnam2, ':');
02688 
02689                                 if (colon2 != NULL)
02690                                         *colon2 = 0;
02691 
02692                                 found = strcmp(ifnam, ifnam2) == 0;
02693                                 if (colon2 != NULL)
02694                                         *colon2 = ':';
02695                         }
02696                         if (found)
02697                                 break;
02698                 }
02699 
02700                 new_ipif += !found;
02701                 if (colon != NULL)
02702                         *colon = ':';
02703         }
02704 
02705         return new_ipif;
02706 }
02707 
02708 static int
02709 ksocknal_start_schedulers(struct ksock_sched_info *info)
02710 {
02711         int     nthrs;
02712         int     rc = 0;
02713         int     i;
02714 
02715         if (info->ksi_nthreads == 0) {
02716                 if (*ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_nscheds > 0) {
02717                         nthrs = info->ksi_nthreads_max;
02718                 } else {
02719                         nthrs = cfs_cpt_weight(lnet_cpt_table(),
02720                                                info->ksi_cpt);
02721                         nthrs = min(max(SOCKNAL_NSCHEDS, nthrs >> 1), nthrs);
02722                         nthrs = min(SOCKNAL_NSCHEDS_HIGH, nthrs);
02723                 }
02724                 nthrs = min(nthrs, info->ksi_nthreads_max);
02725         } else {
02726                 LASSERT(info->ksi_nthreads <= info->ksi_nthreads_max);
02727                 /* increase two threads if there is new interface */
02728                 nthrs = min(2, info->ksi_nthreads_max - info->ksi_nthreads);
02729         }
02730 
02731         for (i = 0; i < nthrs; i++) {
02732                 long            id;
02733                 char            name[20];
02734                 ksock_sched_t   *sched;
02735                 id = KSOCK_THREAD_ID(info->ksi_cpt, info->ksi_nthreads + i);
02736                 sched = &info->ksi_scheds[KSOCK_THREAD_SID(id)];
02737                 snprintf(name, sizeof(name), "socknal_sd%02d_%02d",
02738                          info->ksi_cpt, (int)(sched - &info->ksi_scheds[0]));
02739 
02740                 rc = ksocknal_thread_start(ksocknal_scheduler,
02741                                            (void *)id, name);
02742                 if (rc == 0)
02743                         continue;
02744 
02745                 CERROR("Can't spawn thread %d for scheduler[%d]: %d\n",
02746                        info->ksi_cpt, info->ksi_nthreads + i, rc);
02747                 break;
02748         }
02749 
02750         info->ksi_nthreads += i;
02751         return rc;
02752 }
02753 
02754 static int
02755 ksocknal_net_start_threads(ksock_net_t *net, __u32 *cpts, int ncpts)
02756 {
02757         int     newif = ksocknal_search_new_ipif(net);
02758         int     rc;
02759         int     i;
02760 
02761         LASSERT(ncpts > 0 && ncpts <= cfs_cpt_number(lnet_cpt_table()));
02762 
02763         for (i = 0; i < ncpts; i++) {
02764                 struct ksock_sched_info *info;
02765                 int cpt = (cpts == NULL) ? i : cpts[i];
02766 
02767                 LASSERT(cpt < cfs_cpt_number(lnet_cpt_table()));
02768                 info = ksocknal_data.ksnd_sched_info[cpt];
02769 
02770                 if (!newif && info->ksi_nthreads > 0)
02771                         continue;
02772 
02773                 rc = ksocknal_start_schedulers(info);
02774                 if (rc != 0)
02775                         return rc;
02776         }
02777         return 0;
02778 }
02779 
02780 int
02781 ksocknal_startup (lnet_ni_t *ni)
02782 {
02783         ksock_net_t  *net;
02784         int           rc;
02785         int           i;
02786 
02787         LASSERT (ni->ni_lnd == &the_ksocklnd);
02788 
02789         if (ksocknal_data.ksnd_init == SOCKNAL_INIT_NOTHING) {
02790                 rc = ksocknal_base_startup();
02791                 if (rc != 0)
02792                         return rc;
02793         }
02794 
02795         LIBCFS_ALLOC(net, sizeof(*net));
02796         if (net == NULL)
02797                 goto fail_0;
02798 
02799         spin_lock_init(&net->ksnn_lock);
02800         net->ksnn_incarnation = ksocknal_new_incarnation();
02801         ni->ni_data = net;
02802         ni->ni_peertimeout    = *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_peertimeout;
02803         ni->ni_maxtxcredits   = *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_credits;
02804         ni->ni_peertxcredits  = *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_peertxcredits;
02805         ni->ni_peerrtrcredits = *ksocknal_tunables.ksnd_peerrtrcredits;
02806 
02807         if (ni->ni_interfaces[0] == NULL) {
02808                 rc = ksocknal_enumerate_interfaces(net);
02809                 if (rc <= 0)
02810                         goto fail_1;
02811 
02812                 net->ksnn_ninterfaces = 1;
02813         } else {
02814                 for (i = 0; i < LNET_MAX_INTERFACES; i++) {
02815                         int    up;
02816 
02817                         if (ni->ni_interfaces[i] == NULL)
02818                                 break;
02819 
02820                         rc = lnet_ipif_query(ni->ni_interfaces[i], &up,
02821                                 &net->ksnn_interfaces[i].ksni_ipaddr,
02822                                 &net->ksnn_interfaces[i].ksni_netmask);
02823 
02824                         if (rc != 0) {
02825                                 CERROR("Can't get interface %s info: %d\n",
02826                                        ni->ni_interfaces[i], rc);
02827                                 goto fail_1;
02828                         }
02829 
02830                         if (!up) {
02831                                 CERROR("Interface %s is down\n",
02832                                        ni->ni_interfaces[i]);
02833                                 goto fail_1;
02834                         }
02835 
02836                         strlcpy(net->ksnn_interfaces[i].ksni_name,
02837                                 ni->ni_interfaces[i],
02838                                 sizeof(net->ksnn_interfaces[i].ksni_name));
02839                 }
02840                 net->ksnn_ninterfaces = i;
02841         }
02842 
02843         /* call it before add it to ksocknal_data.ksnd_nets */
02844         rc = ksocknal_net_start_threads(net, ni->ni_cpts, ni->ni_ncpts);
02845         if (rc != 0)
02846                 goto fail_1;
02847 
02848         ni->ni_nid = LNET_MKNID(LNET_NIDNET(ni->ni_nid),
02849                                 net->ksnn_interfaces[0].ksni_ipaddr);
02850         list_add(&net->ksnn_list, &ksocknal_data.ksnd_nets);
02851 
02852         ksocknal_data.ksnd_nnets++;
02853 
02854         return 0;
02855 
02856  fail_1:
02857         LIBCFS_FREE(net, sizeof(*net));
02858  fail_0:
02859         if (ksocknal_data.ksnd_nnets == 0)
02860                 ksocknal_base_shutdown();
02861 
02862         return -ENETDOWN;
02863 }
02864 
02865 
02866 static void __exit ksocklnd_exit(void)
02867 {
02868         lnet_unregister_lnd(&the_ksocklnd);
02869 }
02870 
02871 static int __init ksocklnd_init(void)
02872 {
02873         int rc;
02874 
02875         /* check ksnr_connected/connecting field large enough */
02876         CLASSERT(SOCKLND_CONN_NTYPES <= 4);
02877         CLASSERT(SOCKLND_CONN_ACK == SOCKLND_CONN_BULK_IN);
02878 
02879         /* initialize the_ksocklnd */
02880         the_ksocklnd.lnd_type     = SOCKLND;
02881         the_ksocklnd.lnd_startup  = ksocknal_startup;
02882         the_ksocklnd.lnd_shutdown = ksocknal_shutdown;
02883         the_ksocklnd.lnd_ctl      = ksocknal_ctl;
02884         the_ksocklnd.lnd_send     = ksocknal_send;
02885         the_ksocklnd.lnd_recv     = ksocknal_recv;
02886         the_ksocklnd.lnd_notify   = ksocknal_notify;
02887         the_ksocklnd.lnd_query    = ksocknal_query;
02888         the_ksocklnd.lnd_accept   = ksocknal_accept;
02889 
02890         rc = ksocknal_tunables_init();
02891         if (rc != 0)
02892                 return rc;
02893 
02894         lnet_register_lnd(&the_ksocklnd);
02895 
02896         return 0;
02897 }

02900 MODULE_DESCRIPTION("TCP Socket LNet Network Driver");
02901 MODULE_VERSION("2.8.0");
02902 MODULE_LICENSE("GPL");
02903 
02904 module_init(ksocklnd_init);
02905 module_exit(ksocklnd_exit);
